body_text.text: Study on relationship between insulin resistance and fatty liver in different causes RUIHONG ZHANG, RENHUA ZHANG

Objectives It is well know that insulin resistance associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver. The aim of this study was to investigate whether or not insulin resistance exists in patients with fatty liver induced by different cause. Methods Total of 78 with fatty liver was enrolled in this study. Aged from 20 to72 y. 32 patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver, 28 patients with alcoholic fatty liver, 20 patients with hepatitis virus fatty liver. 18 were in control. All cases were measure there fasting blood glucose and serum fasting insulin level. Insulin resistance was determined by the homeostasis model assessment. Insulin resistance (IR) were compared with normal subjects and three group fatty liver. Results Compared with controls (3.5 ± 0.3), The IR values in nonalcoholic fatty liver group (4.83 ± 0.42), alcoholic fatty liver group (4.38 ± 0.41) and hepatitis virus fatty liver group (3.98 ± 0.31) were significantly higher (p < 0.01). Compared with healthy subjects, three groups fatty liver patients all had lower insulin sensitivity. Conclusion Hyperinsulinemia and insulin resistance occur frequently in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver; our data suggest that may play a role in the pathogenesis of alcoholic fatty liver and hepatitis virus fatty liver. female patients were 14.42% (135/936) and 10.35% (56/541) (P > 0.05). The rate (37.21%) of HCV infection in the patients with liver cirrhosis was significantly higher than that in the patients with hepatitis (12.32%) and in the patients with hepatocelluler carcinoma (6.67%, P < 0.01). The positive rates of HCV infection in various hepatitis were in order of severe hepatitis (33.33%) > chronic hepatitis (17.58%; of which, CPH 13.99% and CAH 29.41%) > acute hepatitis (9.83%) > HBV carrier (6.12%). Sex, age, profession, seasonal distribution and other epidemiological characteristics were discussed for the purpose of scientific preventive measures and preventive strategy development. Conclusions HCV infection might have played a certain role in the occurrence of these liver diseases. As indicated in our data, no sex difference was observed with HCV infection among liver diseases patients, but HCV infection rate increased with age, the highest seroprevalence of HCV was particularly in Group above-50-year-old. Therefore, it is important to study and prevent hepatitis C in Yunnan Province.

body_text.text: Atrophic gastritis and alternation in mucosal color JIA CAI, HESHENG LUO, YIJUAN DING, ET AL.

Objective To study the relationship between atrophic gastritis and alternation in mucosal color. Method All 30 patients were examined by the same endoscopy and two samples of gastric mucosa were examined by the same pathologist. The endoscopic pictures of 30 patients with different gastric diseases were studied using high pathologic image analysis system (HPIAS-2000) and under the same gastric pressure (15 mmHg), biopsies were taken from the position taken photos. The results of HPIAS of gastric mucosa were compared with the results of pathological study. Results There were 15 cases of chronic superficial gastritis (CSG), 15 cases of chronic atrophic gastritis (CAG) in all 30 patients. For CSG, comparing with pathology, endoscopic results had 33.3% of sensitivity and 45.5% of positive predictive value. In contrast their specific rate and negative predictive value were 60.0% • 47.4% respectively. Comparing with pathological results, the diagnostic standard of white area more than 50% by HPIAS had 26.7% of sensitivity and 33.3% of positive predictive value. In contrast their specific rate and negative predictive value were 46.7% and 38.9% respectively. There were no significant difference whose percentage of white area more than 50% in CSG and CAG patients (P > 0.05) as well as the maximum dispersion of luminosity between red and white area in mucosa color (P > 0.5). Conclusion The mucosal color was nonspecific for pathologic diagnosis.We cannot consider the mucosal color which is white in red background as a diagnostic standard of atrophic gastritis.

FIGREF3.text: expressions of hTERT mRNA in the exfoliated cells of serous effusions and its significance KUNHE ZHANG, QUBO FU, FENG CAO, JINQUN ZHU, JIANG CHEN, NONGHUA LU, XUN ZHU, CHONGWEN WANG The Digestive Disease Institute of Jiangxi Medical College, Nanchang, Jiangxi, ChinaObjectives The telomerase activity assay of the exfoliative cells of serous effusions has been considered to be valuable for the diagnosis of malignant effusions, but its value is limited by false positive results. For investigating the causes of the false positive result, the expressions of telomerase reverse transcriptase (hTERT) mRNA were analyzed by in situ hybridization (ISH) in serous effusion cells.Materials and methodsAccording to the cytological diagnosis, the specimens were divided into benign, malignant and suspected effusion groups. The exfoliative cells were fixed in 1% paraformaldehyde, and then cell smears were prepared for ISH analysis.The results of ISH analysis were recorded as the negative, slight positive, positive and strong positive according to the stain intensity. Results Specimens from 63 patients (32 pleural effusions and 31 ascites) were analyzed. There were 36 malignant, 19 benign and 8 suspected malignant effusions. The expressions of hTERT mRNA were very strong in metastatic tumor cells with strong positive 91.7% and positive 8.3%, weak in mesothelial cells with slight positive 54.0%, positive 22.2%, negative 19.0%, strong positive 4.8%, and very weak in lymphocytes with negative 74.6%, slight positive 20.6%, positive 3.2%. The difference among them is significant (p < 0.01). A specimen with positive or strong positive expression was considered as positive. The positive rates are 100% in malignant effusions, 47.4% in benign effusions and 75.0% in suspected malignant effusions, and with a significant difference among them (P < 0.05). Conclusions The expressions of hTERT mRNA are very strong in metastatic tumor cells of malignant effusions with a positive rate of 100%, weak in mesothelial cells with a positive rate of 47.4% in benign effusions, very weak in lymphocytes. The telomerase activity in effusions is mainly from the tumor cells, some from mesothelial cells and a little from lymphocytes.

FIGREF4.text: of estrogen receptor (ER) a and b subtypes in cholangiocytes of PBC ANLIN MA, SHIYU DU, SHUE LIU, HONGCHUAN ZHAO Department of Gastroenterology, China-Japan Friendship Hospital, Beijing 10029, China Objectives We investigated the expression of estrogen receptor (ER) a and b subtypes in cholangiocytes of PBC patients. In association with cholangiocyte proliferation and liver cirrhosis. Methods ER-a and ER-b were analyzed by immunohistochemistry, reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction in the liver biopsy material of 24 female PBC patients. Results The positive signal of ER-a distributed in parenchymal hepatic cells of 8 patients, especially near the hepatic centrolobular and periportal areas. 6 patients only expressed ER-b in Cholangiocytes. 4 patients expressed both ER-a and ER-b subtypes in cholangiocytes. The ER-b expression significant associated with cholangiocytes proliferation and liver cirrhosis. Conclusions This study suggests that estrogens and their receptors play a role in the modulation of cholangiocyte proliferation and pregression of liver cirrhosis in PBC patients. TABREF30.text: features analysis of 201 cases of ulcerative colitis in West China Hospital HONGLIANG LIANG 1 , YUFANG WANG 1 , QIN OUYANG 1 , LI YANG 1 Departments of Gastroenterology,West China hospital, Sichuan Universtiy 1 , Chengdu, ChinaObjective To review and analysis clinical characters of hospitalized ulcerative colitis (UC) in West China hospital within past 13 years and try to find out some differences in clinical presentation with Western cases.Materials and MethodsWe collected 201 cases with UC who was diagnosed in West China Hospital of Sichuan University in past 13 years and the retrospective analysis was performed. Results The ratio of the male and the female was 1.96: 1 and the peak ill age of UC was 30-50 year old, the average onset age was 44.2 ± 13.8 year, course of disease were 1~10 years (55.2%). The common clinical presentation were diarrhea (98.5%), bloody stools (80%), 40.5% cases have abdomen tenderness, 30.06% cases have mild anemia, 64.58% WBC account was normal and 68.23% cases' stool routine examination were abnormal, 76.2% stool culture were negative. Diffusing (92.4%) or continous lesions (88.9%) in colon with hyperemia, edema (89.8%) and erosion or ulcer (74.5%) were most common manifestation under the colonoscopy. About the locations, only involved in rectum and sigmoid flexure (26.4%), whole colon (25.8%) and left colon (25.0%). 96% were active UC, mild and moderate 56.7%, 66.7% chronic relapsing type. The efficient rate of medical therapy was 91.5%, only 2.5% was operated on because of severe complications. Conclusion Compared with Western cases, UC hospitalized cases in Western China hospital tends to be distal colitis and mild to moderately ill case predominant, chronic relapsing type with a later age of onset of the disease.Study on the effects of biofeedback therapy and longtem outcome of biofeedback in functional constipationLIN ZHENG, LIN LIN, ZHAO ZHIQUAN, ZHANG HONGJIE, WANG MEIFENG Gastroenterology, First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University, Jiangsu, China

back_matter.text: The clinical significance of intestinal permeability changing in cirrhotic patients with spontaneous ascitic fluid infection CHANGQING GUO, HONGCHUN HUANG, JICHANG LI, ET AL.

Aims To evaluate the change and clinical significance of intestinal permeability in hepatitis cirrhosis patients with Spontaneous Ascitic Fluid Infection (SAI). Materials and Methods 45 hepatitis cirrhosis patients with ascites were sorted into two groups: SAI group including 34 cases and SA control group including 11 cases. To evaluate intestinal permeability, the concentration of lactulose and mannitol in urine was measured using high-pressure liquid chromatograph with refractive index detector (HPLC-RID), and the levels of urinary excretion of LAC/MAN ratios were calculated. The plasma and ascitic fluid levels of endotoxin were measured with limulus amebocyte lysate test. Correlation between plasma endotoxin level and intestinal permeability was assessed by the method of Pearson correlation coefficients. Results The levels of urinary excretion of LAC/MAN ratios were significantly higher in cirrhotic patients with SAI than those in SA group in admitting hospital (P < 0.05). And they were higher in cirrhosis with SA than those in healthy control group (P < 0.05); The plasma and ascitic levels of endotoxin were significantly higher in cirrhosis patients with SAI than those in SA group in admitting hospital (P < 0.05). And they were higher in cirrhosis with SA than those in healthy control group (P < 0.05); By Pearson correlation, in SAI patients, the levels of urinary excretion of LAC/MAN ratios had significantly correlated with the level of endotoxin (r = 0.187, P < 0.001); After being treated for one week, the levels of urinary excretion of LAC/MAN ratios, the plasma and ascitic levels of endotoxin of cirrhotic patients with SAI were significantly decreased but only to the levels of those patients without SAI (P < 0.05). Conclusions The intestinal permeability in hepatitis cirrhosis patients is increased;The intestinal permeability participates in pathophysiological mechanisms of cirrhosis with SAI. To detect the change of intestinal permeability may be used as indexes for judging treatment efficacy and predicting prognosis.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou 450052, China

back_matter.text: The study on the treatment of NAFLD by compound traditional Chinese medicine -the role of PPAR-a and ligands FENGXIA LI, ZONGSHUN LV

Objects To study the effect of compound traditional Chinese medicine in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. Material and Methods 46 Wistar rats, control group (n = 8), normal diet; model group (n = 14); traditional Chinese medicine high dose group (n = 8); traditional Chinese medicine low dose group (n = 8); gemfibrozil group (n = 8). All rats were sacrificed after 8 weeks. Examined body weight, liver weight, ALT, AST, TC, TG, FFA in serum and hepatic tissue and the expression of acyl-CoA oxidase (AOX) by RT-PCR. Results 1. lipids: The mean of TC, TG, FFA were significantly lower in three treatment groups than that in model group (P < 0.05). 2. ALT, AST: the mean is higher in gem group than that in traditional Chinese medicine high dose group (P < 0.05). 3. AOXmRNA: the expression of AOXmRNA was higher in three treatment groups than that in model group (P < 0.05). 4. Histology: The level of steatosis and steatohepatitis were significantly lower in traditional Chinese medicine high dose group and gem group than that in model group (P < 0.05). Conclusions 1. The effect of compound traditional Chinese medicine is remarkable in NAFLD. 2. Ligands of PPAR-a is prospective in the NAFLD.Objectives To establish the normal value of psychometric test and to investigate the prevalence of SHE in Chinese patients with stabilized hepatic cirrhosis. Materials and Methods 409 consecutive cirrhotic patients were screened for SHE by using number connection test part A (NCT) and symbol digit test (SDT). The age-corrected normal values were defined as the mean ±2 standard deviation, and developed in 356 healthy persons as normal controls. 416 patients with chronic viral hepatitis were tested as negative controls to assess the diagnostic validity of this test battery. Results There was no significant difference in NCT scores and SDT quotients between healthy controls and chronic hepatitis group (p > 0.05). In all age subgroups, the NCT and SDT measurements of cirrhotic patients differed significantly from those of the controls (p < 0.05).When mean ± 2SD of SDT and NCT measurements from healthy control group was set as normal range, 119 cirrhotic patients (29.1%) were found to have abnormal NCT and SDT tests, 53 (13.0%) being abnormal only in SDT and 36 (8.8%) only in NCT. Taken together, SHE was diagnosed in 208 (50.9%) cirrhotic patients by this test battery.The prevalence of SHE increased from 39.9% and 55.2% in Child-Pugh grade A and B to 71.8% in grade C (p < 0.05).
back_matter.section: Department of gastroenterology, Tianjin general hospital, China

back_matter.text: The experimental study of DC in the formation of rat liver fibrosis XIAOHONG LIAO 1 , DONGBIN ZHOU 1 , BO WANG 2 , TIANCAI WANG 2 , ZHIYONG ZHANG 3 Objective To study the role of intergrina 4 b 1 /VCAM-1 and FN in mediating MC recruitment during rat liver fibrosis and the probable mechanics of DC in preventing and treating rat liver fibrosis. Methods 80 male SD rats used for CCl4-induced liver fibrosis models. To study the relations between DC and connective tissues with photoscopy and electroscopy. Results (1) The numbers of MCs in the liver tissues increased markedly with fibrosis development. And most of MCs distributed along collagenous fibrils. (2) 76.4% MC S expressed integrina 4 b 1 positively. (3) Vascular endothelium in liver tissues and hepatic sinusoid endothelium expressed VCAM-1 positively. (4) And there were a number of FN between hepatic lobuli and in the periportal spaces. (5) The expresses of collage I and collage III have significant distinction between DC groups and model groups, P < 0.05.Conclusions Ingtegria 4 b 1 and its two ligands (VCAM-1 and FN) was a very important pathway mediating MCs recruitment in rat liver fibrosis. MCs were closely correlated to liver fibrosis. DC has some effect in preventing and treating rat liver fibrosis.

Invention of KangXian FuFang I on expression of extracellular matrix and matrix metalloproteinases in cultural hepatic stellate cells stimulated by acetaldehyde HONG LIN, YIXIA ZHANG, YILING LI, WEI CUI, BINGYUAN WANG, BAOYU FU Department of Gastroenterology, Number One Hospital of China Medical University, Shenyang 110001, China Objective To investigate the effects of acetaldehyde on extracellular matrix and matrix metalloproteinases in cultural hepatic stellate cells (HSC) and invention of KangXian FuFang I (KXI) on them. Methods The hepatic stellate cells were primarily cultured and subcultured in vitro in rats. The drug serum containing KXI was collected from the normal rats. HSCs were treated with acetaldehyde and drug serum. The content of laminin (LN) in conditional media, expression of type I (and IV) collagen (a1) mRNA and MMP-1, 2 mRNA in stimulated HSC were measured with radioimmunoassay and reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), respectively. Results After acetaldehyde (100 mM) stimulated HSCs for 24 hr, secretion of LN in conditioned media, expression of a1(I)collagen mRNA and MMP-2 mRNA in HSCs increased. The drug serum (10%) could obviously inhibit this stimulating action. While expression of a1(IV)collagen mRNA and MMP-1 mRNA decreased in the same condition. The drug serum (10%) could increase their expression. Conclusion The results indicated that KXI could inhibit secretion of LN, expression of a1(I)collagen mRNA and MMP-2 mRNA and increase expression of a1(IV)collagen mRNA and MMP-1 mRNA in HSCs stimulated by acetaldehyde.

back_matter.text: The clinical application in the diagnosis of the cancer of liver with infrared photography XIANG LIN, YAN CAO, HANSHENG WU, ET AL.

Objective To investigate the value of infrared photography in the diagnosis of cancer of liver. Methods By applying THV570 Infrared Photography Diagnosis System, we test and take infrared photographies of the liver regions of 70 people in good health, 25 people with cyst o fliver and 30 people with cancer of liver in covertional operation, then contrast and analyse the consequences of the three groups. Result There are 4 people in the 70 people in good health with the liver region temperature (the warmest region temperature of the liver) ≥36°C with the proportion of 5.7%, there are 3 in the 25 people with cyst of liber with the proportion of 83.3%. There are 8 people in the 70 people in good health with the temperature difference between the warmest region of liver and the relevant region with the peoportion of 11.4%, there are 4 in the 25 people with cyst of liver with the proportion of 16%, while there are 22 in the 30 people with cancer of liver with the proportion of 73.3%. Conclusions It has been proved by laboratory observing and clinical examination that abnormal liver infrared photography is closely related to the cancer of liver and the liver Infrared Photography Test is convenient, ewnomical, no injury, no damage by ray. It can be used as a new test method in general survey in the common people and in Aims The experiment is applied to observe the therapeutic effect of the external application of mirabilite in the assistant treatment of liver cirrhosis ascites and investigate the functional mechanism of the therapy. Materials and Methods 41 cases of liver cirrhosis ascites were hospitalized to receive treatment of routine liver protection, low albumen correction, diuresis, and etc. They were randomly divided into the treatment group of the mirabilite and control group of the routine treatment, among them, 20 cases of mirabilite, and 21 cases of the routine treatments. For cases in the mirabilite group, the external application of mirabilite is used in the assistant treatment of liver cirrhosis ascites for comparison of the therapeutic effects. Seven days is calculated as a period of treatment. B-ultra appliances are used to recheck the volume of ascites in the patients before and after the treatment, leather ruler to reexamine the circulating length of their abdomen to see the effect.

The results were favorable and evident. For both groups the patients lost some serous fluid. The recheck showed that the decrease of the fluid of the treatment group was (38.3 ± 18.55) mm, t = 4.75, P < 0.01; and in comparison, the control group is (21.4 ± 14.24) mm, t = 2.25, P < 0.05. This revealed a remarkable difference of t = 3.23, P < 0.01. For the treatment group, the decrease of circulating length of their abdomen before and after the therapy is (4.7 ± 2.92) cm, and t = 7.23, P < 0.01, the comparison group is (2.7 ± 2.657) cm, and before and after the therapy t is 4.50, P < 0.01; Which also showed a great difference: t = 2.265, P < 0.05. Besides, the patients in the treatment group defecated more in frequency and quantity and without electrolyte foul-up and spontaneous peritoneum inflammation.Conclusions The treatment showed that the external application of mirabilite could help the dilatation of some blood vessels, expedite the blood flow, and improve the micro-circulation. The absorption of the ascites was better in the treatment group than that in the control group, which showed that the external application of mirabilite can absorb large quantity of serous fluid, facilitate vermiculation of stomach and intestines, assist the restoration of the function in digestion, accordingly it can release the abdomen bulge of the patients and improve their life quality. To sum up, the external application of mirabilite is convenient, efficient, and relatively cheap. It is recommended for wider adoption in daily therapy.

Biophysics interventions where biology fails: a breakthrough biophysical methodology counteracting cirrhosis progression G. MARINEO, F. MAROTTA, G. SISTI Delta Research & Development, Research Centre for Medical Bioengineering-"Tor Vergata" University, Rome, Italy Introduction Besides transplantation (OLTx), liver cirrhosis has no valid therapeutic options and a relentless progression with overcoming complication is still a dismal prospective while OLTx waiting lists hugely enlarge. Aims & Methods A pilot study was designed with a novel biophysical methodology as a new treatment modality. Such non-invasive technique has as a main principle the "decrease of entropy", which can be artificially obtained through an electromagnetic-driven delivery of "energy clusters". This has been modulated so as to be used by the body and integrated as "self" to support and charge the energy-dependent functional stores thus modifying reparative into regenerative mechanisms of liver parenchyma. We studied 5 HCV+ (Child A-B) cirrhotics with overt symptomatology and portal hypertension who stopped any medication and underwent daily 40 min sessions of Delta-S DVD, an entropy-variation system, for six months and followed up monthly. Results After six months patients showed either a complete (80%) or a partial (20%) regression of fatigue (Fisk score), a complete reversion of depression (Hamilton score), peripheral edema and pruritus. As assessed by independent observers, despite having stopped betablockers, F1 varices disappeared (60%) while F2 ones were reduced to F1. Doppler-US aspect of partial (40%) or total (20%) atrophy were either reduced (60%) or reverted to normal (20%) while overt scarring nodules disappeared in 40%. Portal vein respiratory dynamics improved (80%) or normalized (20%). A significant increase of active Blymphocytes and NK cells (mean increase: +71, 2% p < 0.002) also occurred. Conclusion Although limited, such preliminary data suggest that this novel biophysical technique can positively affect "biologicallyirreversible" parameters, thus representing a promising new modality to effectively treat liver cirrhosis.

Effect of losartan on the expression of Timp-1 and PAI-1 in the liver of rat with hepatic fibrosis YANNI MENG, GUIYING ZHANG Department of Gastroenterology, Xiangya Hospital, Central South University, Changsha 410008, China Objectives To study the effect of losartan on the expression of tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinase-1 (TIMP-1) and plasminogen activator inhibition-1 (PAI-1) in the liver of rat with hepatic fibrosis. Materials Methods Forty-eight SD rats were separated into four groups (model, prevent, treatment, control) . Excepting rats in control group, all rats were given subcutaneous injection of carbon tetrachloride. Rats in prevent and treatment groups were also given losartan via gastrogavage. At the end of 12 weeks, rats were sacrificed. HE, VG staining were used to evaluate the degree of fibrosis, Immunochemistry was used to detect the expression of TIMP-1 and PAI-1 in the liver tissue, respectively. Results Compared with model group, Losartan greatly attenuated the degree of liver fibrosis and significantly inhibit the expression of TIMP-1, PAI-1 in the liver of prevent and treatment group (P < 0.05). However, there was no obvious significantly difference between prevent and treatment group (P > 0.05). Conclusion Losartan can markly attenuate the degree of hepatic fibrosis.

back_matter.text: Immunological effect of the therapeutic vaccination in patients with chronic hepatitis B FENYU REN, XIXU PIAO, SHUZI REN, HAICHENG PEI Department of Gastroenterology and Hepatology Yanbian University School of Medicine,Yanji, China Objectives Recent available therapeutic approaches to control chronic hepatitis B are unsatisfactory. Several pilot studies of vaccine therapy in human with chronic hepatitis B showed encouraging results. In the present study, to investigate the antiviral mechanism of vaccine therapy in chronic hepatitis B patients. Materials and Methods Vaccinated 13 patients were analyzed for T cell proliferative responses specific for enverope antigen and cytokine production by antigen-specific T cells. Results Serum HBV DNA levels decreased significantly at 6 months after completion of therapy and thereafter as compared to the baseline ones. Vacccination induced antigen-specific CD4 + T cell proliferative responses in 5 Patients (38.5%). The production of high levels of interferon-and tumor necrosis factor-a by antigen-specific T cells was found in 5 Patients who shouwed significantly lower HBV DNA levels in serum at 6 and 18 months after completion of therapy than those without high levels of cytokine production. Conclusions These results suggest that envelope-specific CD4 + T cells directly control HBV replication by producing antiviral cytokines in the therapeutic vaccination against chronic HBV infection.

back_matter.text: Construction and application of the phage display single strain antibody (SCFV) library against hepatocellullar carcinoma (HCC) JIANCHANG SHU 1 , DONGHUA YANG 2 , JINGRUN ZHAO 1 , XIA LV 1 , SHAOHUI TANG 2 Objective To construct a specific phage ScFv library against HCC with large content, good diversity, and identify its biologic features and functions. Methods Spleen mRNA of immunized Balb/c mice was purified. The cDNA was synthesized from mRNA. The antibody heavy (V H ) and light (V L ) chain DNA and ScFv gene were generated.With phage display and gene clone technology, the primary phage library against HCC was constructed and identified. The recombinant phage library was panned with HCC cells and normal hepatic cells to construct the secondary library specific to HCC. E. coli HB2151 was infected by the specific recombinant phage. The ScFv antibody expression was induced by IPTG. ScFv antibodies were analyzed with SDSpolyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. The inhibitory influence of the ScFv on HCC cell was detected with microscope and MTT colorimetric method. By ABC immunohistochemical technique, the specificity of the ScFv antibody against HCC cell was identified. Results The phage library against HCC was constructed with library content of 5.3 ¥ 10 7 . The concentration of expressed ScFv antibody was 0.8 mg/ml. The molecular weight of the ScFv antibody was 31KD. The nucleotides sequencing showed 750 bp fragment including V H of 344 bp and V L of 306 bp. ScFv antibody inhibited HCC cell growth.The highest inhibitory rate was 31.0%. ScFv library showed positive ABC staining with two HCC cells. Conclusions A phage library against HCC with large content, high affinity and strong specificity had been constructed. The ScFv antibody showed high specificity to HCC cells, and inhibited HCC cells growth remarkably.

Effects Objective To investigate the effects of Chinese traditional compound of JinSanE and the changes of transforming growth factor-beta1 (TGF-b)/Smad signaling pathway system liver fibrosis in rat.

Wistar rats were divided into four groups, including normal group, model group, JinSanE group I and JinSanE Group II. Except for normal, all groups injentived CCl 4 for 8 weeks. At the beginning of the first and fourth week, rats in JinSanE group I and II were ofally treated with JinSanE Therapeutic effects of JinSanE was evaluated by the expression of TGF-b1 and TGF-b1 type II receptor (TR II) mRNA in the liver by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction, the expressions of TGF-b1, Smad3 and Smad7 in liver by immunohistochemistry, the liver histopathology was examined by HE staining. The activities of serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), the levels of serum hyaluronic acid (HA) were assayed. Results Experimental hepatic fibrosis was significantly inhibited by JinSanE. The degrees of necrosis and fibrosis scores were significantly lower in the JinSanE groups than in the model group (P < 0.05). The expression of TGF-b1, TR II and Smad3 were significantly higher in the model group than those in the JinSanE groups (P < 0.01). The amounts of positive staining Smad7 cells were significantly less in the model group than in the JinSanE groups and normal group (P < 0.01). The contents of ALT, ASTand HA were significantly lower in the JinSanE groups than those in the model group (P < 0.01). Conclusions JinSanE prevented the progression of hepatic damage and fibrosis through the inhibition of TGF-b1, TR II and Smad3 signal protein, and increased expression of Smad7 signal protein in vivo.

Dioctahedral smectite combined with Da Ji was used in curing cirrhosis of liver with diarrhea 60 cases MINXIAN SUN Department of Digestion, The 2 nd People's Hospital of Dalian City, Liaoning 116000, ChinaObjective To compare effect of using DS combined with DJ with DS or DJ being used alone in curing cirrhosis of liver with diarrhea. Method 60 cases were selected according to diagnostic criteria for cirrhosis of liver and eliminating infective and drug effective factor. Divided these cases into three groups, DS were given to control group A, 3 g three times daily, DJ was given to control group B, 2 pills three times daily, DS combined with DJ were given to treated group C with the amount of dosage is the same as above. The course of treatment is 10 days. Result There were 20 cases in each group. 4 cases of notable result, 6 cases of effective result and 10 cases of inefficient result were found in group A. 3 cases of notable result, 5 cases of effective result and 12 cases of inefficient result were found in group B. 16 cases of notable result, 3 cases of effective result and 11 cases of inefficient result were found in group C. the total effective rate in group A. B. and C. was 50%, 40% and 90% respectively. There was significant difference between treated group and two control groups, p < 0.05. Conclusion The curative effect of using DS combined with DJ in curing cirrhosis of liver with diarrhea is better than that of using DS or DJ alone.

The expression of hypoxia-inducible factor-1a in rat liver of cold/warm ischemia/ Objective To find effective way to reduce ischemia/reperfusion injury, we investigate the expressions of hypoxia-inducible factor-1a (HIF-1a) in rat liver following cold/warm ischemia/reperfusion. Material and method SD rats were divided into 11 groups randomly. Models of warm ischemia/reperfusion, cold ischemia/reperfusion and orthotopic liver transplantation were made. The expressions HIF-1a were examined with method of immunohistochemistry. The quantity analyses of the expression of HIF-1a were made by image analysis instrument. The changes of HIF-1a expression at 1 hour of ischemia and 0, 1, 12 and 72 h of reperfusion were examined. Results In groups of warm ischemia, the expression of HIF-1a increased 1 hour after ischemia, and laid in summit 12 of reperfusion. Then, it decreased at 72 hours of reperfusion, while still higher than that of control. In this group, the expressions of HIF-1a were strengthened in region I of liver acinus while weak in region II and III. In Group of cold ischemia, the expressions of HIF-1a were lower, but up-regulated at 72 hour of reperfusion. Conclusion HIF-1a can be induced immediately after warm ischemia, and expressed in regions of low oxygen supply. It may be related to the generation of vessel.
The hepatic injury in elderly patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome: retrospective analysis GENG TIAN, TAI-CHANG ZHANG, HUIQING YANG
Objectives To study the liver injury in elderly patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome retrospectively.
back_matter.section: Digestive Department, Xuanwu Hospital of Capital University, China

back_matter.text: We study the symptoms/physical signs and liver function (ALT, AST,TBIL, DBIL,TBA), complications and prognosis patients with SARS retrospectively. Results The symptoms and physical signs of the digestive system in elderly patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome were diarrhea (19.5%), abdominal pain (7.3%). The tests of liver functions showed the levels of ALT (45.83 ± 43.82) u/L, AST (33.83 ± 28.04) u/L, TBIL (7.31 ± 14.84) umol/L, DBIL (6.89 ± 6.88) umol/L and TBA (3.92 ± 3.15 ) umol/L in elderly patients and the levels ALT (57.55 ± 48.80) u/L, AST (35.00 ± 35.25) u/L, TBIL (12.60 ± 7.18) umol/L, DBIL (4.78 ± 4.63) umol/L and TBA (4.85 ± 6.09) umol/Lin adult patients. There is no significant difference between elderly patients and adult patients. But the mean levels of ALT in two groups' patients were higher than normal levels (0-40) u/L. Conclusions The elderly patients with SARS had the liver injury. The reasons of high fatality rate in elderly patients may have some relationships with effects of SARS virus, original diseases and complications.

Serum ascites albumin gradient as a non-invasive parameter for portal hypertension on liver cirrotic patients with ascites at Manado general hospital BJ. WALELENG, NT. WENAS, JV. LUCIDA, C. WIBOWO Gastroenterohepatology, Sam Ratulangi University-Manado General Hospital, Indonesia Aims To assess the correlation of SAAG with portal vein and spleenic vein diameter on LC patients who had PH with ascites.

This is an analytic observasional study with cross sectional design. Subjects are LC patients with ascites who administered in Irina C and/or as out patients in Gastroenterohepatology Clinic at Manado General Hospital from May 2002 to April 2003. Patients who fulfilled the inclutions and exclutions were measured SAAG, and portal vein also spleenic vein diameter by using conventional USG. It was used z test and Pearson's correlation coefficient test for analyzing statistically.Objective To investigate the effects of recombinant human augmentor of liver regeneration (hALR) on c-jun gene expression in hepatic stellate cell. Methods Hepatic stellate cell (HSC-T6) was cultured in medium containing different concentrations of hALR (200 mg/L, 20 mg/L, 2 mg/L respectively) and cells were collected at different incubation period (8, 24, 48, 72 h) . Total RNA of HSC was isolated and c-jun gene expressions level was measured by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction. Results c-jun gene expression levels of HSC in high (200 mg/L), middle (20 mg/L) and low (2 mg/L) concentrations of three hALR groups were much lower than those of control group after exposure to hALR at 8, 24, 48 and 72 h. Low dose group was 60-64% of control group, middle dose group was 41-43% of control group and high dose group were 29-35% of control group. Conclusions hALR could inhibit gene expression of c-jun in hepatic stellate cell.

The study on the changes of blood hormone of live cirrhosis patients FANG WANG, YULAN LIU, WENBIN XIAO Gastroenterology Department Of People's Hospital, Peking University, Beijing 100044, China Objective To study the changes of blood hormone of live cirrhosis patients. Methods A total of 30 live cirrhosis patients (study group) and 10 chronic hepatitis patients (control group) were examined by abdominal ultrosonography, and testet liver function test and H/L. Blood E (epinephrine), NE (norepinephrine), R (rennin), A (angiotensin), Aldo (aldosterone), ANP (atrial natruretic polypeptide), G (glucagon), ET (endothelin) and CGRP (calcitonin gene related protein) were measured. Results There was a significant difference between the epinephrine, norepinephrine of live cirrhosis patients and chronic hepatitis patients (P < 0.05). There were no significant differences among the A (angiotensin), Aldo (aldosterone), ANP (atrial natruretic polypeptide), G (glucagon), ET (endothelin), CGRP (calcitonin gene related protein) of two groups (P > 0.05). There were significant differences among the epinephrine, norepinephrine of Child A, Child B, Child C live cirrhosis patients (P < 0.05).Conclusion Epinephrine and norepinephrine of live cirrhosis patients obviously increase; there was a positive relation with liver function. Objectives To examine the functional characteristics of CD8+ and CD4+ T lymphocytes in liver and in blood of patients with chronic HCV infection. Materials and methods Intrahepatic lymphocytes (IHL) and peripheral blood lymphocytes (PBL) were isolated from paired liver biopsy and blood samples of 14 patients with chronic HCV infection. To examine the cytokine production capability the cells from 8 patients were stimulated with SEB for 5 hours, followed by intracellular staining for IFN. And the expression of Fas, Fas ligand and perforin were assessed by cell surface and intracellular staining, respectively. To examine the proliferation capability of the cells from other 6 patients were stained with CFSE and stimulated with IL-2 and anti-CD3, followed by 6-color flow cytometry. Results 1) Frequencies of IFNg-producing CD8+ and CD4+ T lymphocytes were lower in the liver than those in the blood (2.4 ± 2.5% vs. 6.8 ± 6.9 for CD8+ T cells and, 3.6 ± 1.3% vs. 5.1 ± 4.4% for CD4+ T cells, respectively, p < 0.05). 2) The frequency of per-forin+ CD8+ T lymphocytes was lower in liver than in blood (8.0 ± 5.5% vs. 20.3 ± 11.2%, p < 0.05).

cite_spans.text: WENBIN XIAO Gastroenterology Department Of People's Hospital, Peking University, Beijing 100044, China

back_matter.text: 3) The frequencies of FasL+ T lymphocytes were higher in the liver than than in the blood (2.9 ± 2.5% vs 0.5 ± 0.4 for CD8+ T cells and 8.3 ± 5.0% vs. 1.0 ± 0.8% for CD4+ T cells, both p < 0.05), while the frequencies of Fas+ T lymphocytes were higher in the liver than in blood (91.2 ± 4.6% vs. 75.7 ± 15.8% for CD8+ T cells and 89.0 ± 7.3% vs. 72.7 ± 15.1% for CD4+ T cells, both p < 0.05). 4) Intrahepatic CD4+ and CD8+ T cells did not proliferate when stimulated in vitro with the same condition used for amplifying peripheral T cells. Conclusions intrahepatic CD8+/CD4+ T lymphocytes from chronic hepatitis C patients are functionally different from their counterparts in the peripheral blood, which may contribute to the immunopathogenesis of HCV infection.

It has been suggested that siRNA have the potential to inhibit HBV gene expression and to block the HBV lifecycle by degradation of the pregenomic RNA.The aims of this study were to develop an RNAi approach that specifically targets the precore and core regions and S regions of hepatitis B virus (HBV) by synthesizing short interfering RNA (siRNA) in vivo, and to explore the inhibitory effect of siRNAs on HBV replication and expression.

Four PCR producing siRNA expression cassettes (SECs) which targeted HBV genome different sites of S and preC/C gene and a scramble SECs control directed unrelated sequence were designed and synthesized and their interfering efficacy to viral genome was quantified in HepG2. 2.15 cells by ELISA and dot hybridization method.

The endogenously expressed siRNAs directed at three sites in HBV gene showed a dose-dependent and sequence-specific inhibitory effect on HBV gene expression between PCR products concentrations of 0.5-2.0 ng/ul. HBV-specific siRNA producing system targeted the region 458 to 478 bases in HBV S gene produced the greatest decrease level of HBsAg and HBeAg, with inhibitory rates peaking at 100% and 64.78%. The interfering action was related to time and lasted 12 to 14 days. No inhibitory effect on the replication and expression of HBV were observed in culture cells treated by the scramble control system. The cells remained viable throughout the experiments and no morphological abnormalities and cytotoxicity were examined with SECs at PCR products concentrations below 4 ng/ul. Conclusions Our synthesized HBV-specific siRNAs producing system exhibited high efficient activity to suppress HBV gene replication and expression in HepG2. 2.15 cells, suggesting RNAi-based anti-HBV strategy may open a path toward using siRNAs to improve HBV therapy.

Effect of salvia miltiorrhiza monomer IH764-3 on collagen degredation in rat hepatic fibrosis ZHANKUI WANG 1 , HUIQING JIANG 2 Objective To probe roles of salvia miltiorrhiza monomer IH764-3 in anti-fibrogenesis and the mechanism.Methods Forty male SD rats were divided into three groups at random, control group 10 rats, model group 15 rats and IH764-3 group 15 rats. The hepatic fibrosis was induced by common bile duct ligation. The rats of IH764-3 group received 40 mg kg -1 of IH764-3 introperitoneally, while other rats were injected introperitoneally by equivalent saline. At the fourteenth day, animals were sacrificed. Tissue sections were stained immunohistochemstrically to detect TIMP-1 and TGFb1 positive areas.

The contents of hydroxyproline in model group were higher than those in control group [(0.586 ± 0.070)mg/mg vs (0.178 ± 0.034)mg/mg dry weight (P < 0.01==. Treated by IH764-3, they (0.349 ± 0.058 mg/mg) were lower than those in model group (P < 0.01=. Immunohistochemistrically, the positive areas of TIMP-1 increased more evidently than those in control group (12.36% ± 1.52% vs 4.31% ± 1.02%, P < 0.01=. In IH764-3 group, they were more diminutive than those of model group, which decreased to 7.88% ± 1.24% (P < 0.01=. The positive area of TGFb1 in model group increased from 4.05% ± 0.55% in control group to 10.52% ± 0.74% (P < 0.01=, meanwhile, they decreased to 7.10% ± 1.24% after exposed to IH764-3. TGFb1 was correlated positively with TIMP-1 in all groups (P < 0.05). Conclusions Silvia mitiorrhiza monomer IH764-3 may relieve hepatic fibrosis induced by BDL. It may downregulate the expression of TIMP-1 and TGFb1.
Study on therapeutic effect with a-interferon (IFN) injection/or combine with lamivudin for long term on chronic hepatitis B ZHAOQUAN WANG, XIAOGUANG DOU, ET AL.

Objective To study the therapeutic effect with a-IFN for long term on chronic hepatitis B. Methods The patients of three groups received a-IFN 3 MU, qod, im combines with Lamivudin over one year. The effect was depended on changes of clinical signs, aminotransferase, virology indexes (HBV-Ms). Results Three patients of first group were clinic complete cure. Other tree patients of second group were complete respond. Besides, tree patients were complete respond during therapy combine a-IFN with Lamivudin, but did not fall out of use with a-IFN and Lamivudin, because they were into relapse or break through easily. Conclusion The more patients with chronic hepatitis B could be to best prognosis, when to use a-IFN / or it combine with Lamivudin for long term. But the therapeutic effects were differently in several patients.

Methods A 27-year-old-woman who was hospitalized with food intoxication caused by Amanita phalloides in her 20th week of pregnancy. She suffered a severe liver failure. The previous extracorporeal purification treatments with 2 times of hemodialysis (HD) plus hemo-

Objectives Through investigating serum leptin levels relations with osteocalcin (BGP) and bonal mineral density (BMD), understand the pathophysiology of osteodystrophy in patients with cirrhosis of liver. Materials and Methods Thirty males and ten females patients with post-hepatitis cirrhosis. (mean age 50 years, rage 24-70 years), and age-and-gender-matched controls was include. BMD was measured by using dual energy X-ray absorptiometry, Serum leptin and BGP were measured by using a radioimmunoassay. Body mass index (BMI) was calculated by dividing weight (kg) by squared height (m 2 ). Results 1. No correlation was found between serum leptin levels and BMD or its Z-Score at lumbar spine either in patient group or in control group (P > 0.05, respetively). Subgrouping patients into Child-pugh grade, the result didn't change in male patients either Child-pugh A grade or Child-pugh C grade (P > 0.05, respectively). However, the inverse relationship was observed between serum leptin with BMD and its Z-Score at lumbar spine both in female cirrhosis group (Child-pughA + B) (P < 0.05) and in male cirrhosis of liver group (Child-pughB) (P < 0.05). Serum leptin adjusted for BMI positively correlated with BMD and Z-Score at lumbar spine in female patients with cirrhosis of liver (r = 0.698, 0.399, P < 0.05, respectively) and negatively correlated with BMD at lumbar spine in male patients with cirrhosis of liver (r = -0.576, P < 0.01). 2. There was significantly negatively correlations between serum leptin levels and BGP levels in cirrhotic patients (r = -0.576, P < 0.01). Conclusion Leptin may be a factor in the hepatic bone disease.Objective To investigate the effects of melatonin on nuclear factor kappa B expression of liver fibrosis in rats.

back_matter.text: A rats liver fibrosis model was established by treating with carbon tetrachloride (CCl 4 ). The animals were randomized into 3 groups: normal group, model group, melatonin group (5.0 mg/kg), treated ip with saline, saline, melatonin respectively (once a day, from d 1 to d 90 during the model was prepared). After the end of the experiment, the score of the index of hepatic injury (HI) and the index of fibrosis (FI) were evaluated, the content of nitric oxide (NO) in rats liver homogenate were measured. Meanwhile, the expression of a-smooth muscle actin (SMA), the subunit of nuclear factor kappa B (p65 and p50), and that of iNOS in liver tissue were detected by immunohistochemistry methods. Results After treated with CCl 4 , the HI and FI were increased and the NO content was elevated, the expression of a-SMA, p65, p50 and iNOS protein were intensified in rats liver. Liver fibrosis was significantly improved by melatonin, which were supported by the reduction of the HI and FI.The expression of iNOS protein and the content of NO were downregulated by melatonin through inhibiting the expression of p65 and p50 protein.Conclusion Melatonin could reduce liver fibrosis through inhibiting the nuclear factor kappa B signal transduction to downregulating the expression of iNOS protein and the synthesis of NO.

Effects of estradial ON I, III-type collagens and TGFb 1 in liver of fibrosis rats JUNWANG XU, GONG JUN, XINMING CHANG, JINYAN LUO, LEI DONG, AI JIA, GUIPING XU Department of Gastroenterology, First Hospital of Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China Objectives To study the effects of estradiol on the production of collagen I, III and TGFb 1 in experimental fibrosis rats induced by CCL 4 , and then to investigate the suppressive effects of estrogen on liver fibrosis. Methods Rats were randomly allocated into a normal control group, a model control group, a therapy control group and a estradiol group. Liver fibrosis was induced by CCL 4 administration. The estradiol group, apart from the CCL 4 used, was treated subcutaneausly with estradiol (benzoic estradiol) 1 mg/kg twice weekly. At the end of 8 weeks, all the rats were sacrificed. The liver inflammation and collagen deposition were observed with HE and Masson's collagen stains, analyzed with scoring and staging systems. The I, IIItype collagens and TGFb 1 were observed with immunohistochemical method. Results CCL 4 group had the typical liver fibrosis compared with normal control group. The fibrous septa were formed in CCL 4 group rats, and collagens were accumulated and deposited in the sinusoids and liver lobules. The expression of type I, III collagens (0.58 ± 0.26 vs 6.34 ± 2.24, 1.07 ± 0.49 vs 5.28 ± 1.28, P < 0.001) and TGFb 1 was significantly increased. Estradiol significantly attenuated collagen accumulation (P < 0.05) in the fibrotic livers, and decreased type I, III collagens (2.47 ± 0.76 vs 6.34 ± 2.24, 3.02 ± 1.20 vs 5.28 ± 1.28, P < 0.05) and TGFb 1 expression in the liver. Conclusion Estradiol treatment lowers the synthesis of hepatic type I, III collagens and TGFb 1 in the fibrotic rats induced by CCL 4 administration, and then reduces hepatic fibrosis.

Research on the relationship between ADH and ALDH gene polymorphism and alcoholic liver disease MING YAN, KONGXI ZHU, FANLI MENG, HONGJUAN WANG, MEILING WU Departments of Gastroenterology, Qilu Hospital of Shandong University, Jinan, China Objectives By detecting the genotypes of the key enzymes of alcohol metabolizing in human body, to study the differences of the allele frequencies of ADH and ALDH gene at ADH2, ADH3 and ALDH2 loci in the following 3 groups: healthy control group, alcoholic dependence group (without liver damage), alcoholic liver disease (ALD) group.We hope to investigate the pathogenesis of ALD in view of genetic point, and may give the clinical physicians useful suggestions to prevent alcoholism and ALD. Materials and Methods 5 ml venous blood is taken from each patient of the healthy control group, alcohol dependent group (without liver damage), alcoholic liver disease (ALD) group, each group contains 20 patients. After add EDTA to prevent the blood from coagulating, separate WBC out of the blood within 2 hours. Then to freeze the WBC in liquid nitrogen for later use. DNA is extracted from WBC by saturated phenol method. Then polymerase chain reaction (PCR) is performed after the DNA is purified, sedimented and dissolved. One PCR mixture is for ADH2 and ADH3 gene amplification, another PCR mixture is for ALDH2 gene amplification. Adjust the reaction condition, exam whether there has been some amplification products by electrophoresis in polyacrylamide gel. After the amplification product is precipitated by ethanol, add Mae III to digest ADH2 gene amplification product to detect ADH2*1 and ADH2*2. Add Ssp I to digest ADH3 gene amplification product to detect ADH3*1 and ADH3*2. Add EcorR I to digest ALDH2 gene amplification product to detect ALDH2*1 and ALDH*2. The digested products are run on 14% polyacrylamide gel and stained with ethidium bromide, photographed and analysed by ID Image Analysis Software to determine the genotypes of each gene. Results The frequency of ADH2*1 allele in health control group is 10%, in alcohol dependent group is 30%, in ALD group is 10%; The frequency of ADH2*2 allele in health control group is 90%, in
Shift of Th1/Th2 cells in patient with primary carcinoma of liver SHENG YANG 1 , YINGPING CAO 2 , YANG WEIZHU 1 ET AL.

Objective The study is to comprehend in immunological mechanism of the primary carcinoma of Liver and to develop a basic theory for the immunoloregulation of the disease by analyzing the shift of Th1 and Th2 cell. Methods Serum levels of IL-2, IFN-, IL-4, IL-10 were examined in 24 patients and 24 healthy subjects by using ELISA, the mRNA expression of type 1 cytokines (IL-2, IFN-) and type 2 cytokines (IL-4, IL-10) were also measured by PCR. Results It can be seen that serum levels and mRNA expression of Th1 cell from primary carcinoma of Liver patients was obyiously lower than that from the healthy control (p < 0.05), but serum levels and mRNA expression of Th2 cell from primary carcinoma of Liver patients was obyiously higher than that from healthy control (p < 0.05). Conclusions There exists two sabsets in the primary carcinoma of liver. The Th1 cell trends to the Th2 cell. This may account for the fact that makes tumor cells escape the immune surveillance of the host.Therefore it is very important to maintain the balance of Th cells in patients.
back_matter.section: Depatment of Hepatobiliary Surgery, Union Hospital of Fujian Medical University, Fuzhou 350001, China

back_matter.text: The role of heme oxygenase and carbon monoxide in hyperdynamic circulation of cirrhotic rats SHUPING YANG 1 , JIYAO WANG 2 , JINSHENG GUO 2 Objectives This paper was to explore the role of heme oxygenase and carbon monoxide in the hyperdynamic circulation of cirrhotic rats. Methods Liver cirrhosis was induced by percutaneous administration of carbon tetrachloride (CCl 4 ). A single dose of Zinc protoporphyrin IX (ZnPP), a specific HO inhibitor, was s.c. injected into the posterior neck of rats. Mean arterial pressure (MAP, kPa), heart rate (HR, b/min) and portal pressure (PP, cmH 2 O) were measured by indwelling catheters. Plasma carbon monoxide was measured by Chalmer's method. Heme oxygenase (HO) activity in splanchnic organs from cirrhotic rats and controls was also determined. Results Histologically typical features of cirrhosis were observed in the animals treated with CCl 4 . The cirrhotic group presented a significant increase in PP (P < 0.01) and a significant decrease in MAP (P < 0.01). No differences were observed regarding HR. Percutaneous injection of ZnPP significantly increased MAP (P < 0.05) and significantly decreased PP (P < 0.01) in cirrhotic rats. In a single regression analysis, significant correlation was detected between plasma carbon monoxide and MAP (r = -0.67, P < 0.05). In comparison with controls, HO activity was significantly increased in spleens (80% increase), intestines (100% increase), and mesenteries (30% increase). Conclusions Our finding sugest that heme oxygenase and carbon monoxide may play an important role in hyperdynamic circulation in cirrhosis. Objectives To investigate the anti-cancer mechanism of cisplatin (CDDP) and matrine (MT) that often used in liver cancer treatment by studying their effects on telomerase.

Microculture tetrazolium assay (MTT), flow cytometer (FCM) and PCR-ELISA were employed to determine and observe the killing effect of CDDP and MT, and their effects on adhering ability and telomerase activity of QGY cells. Results CDDP and MT had anti-QGY activity in distinct doseand time-dependent manners in vitro. CDDP had more strong antiadhering activity than MT. Two drugs could obviously inhibit telomerase activity. Conclusions The inhibition of telomerase activity may be one of the mechanism of anti-tumor effect of chemotherapeutic drugs CDDP and MT in liver cancer treatment.

Objective To investigate the mechanism of RSM in treating portal hypertension (PHT). Methods Preparation of RSM cream, with the immunocyte chemistry and LSCM, the study examined effects of RSM on expression of iNOS and eNOS and changes of HSCs [Ca 2+ ]i. Results 1 In activated HSCs, RSM increased the expression of iNOS, the absorbency increased from 0.034 ± 0.001 to 0.053 ± 0.002, P < 0.05, while there showed no significant changes in expression of eNOS; 2 Preincubation with RSM in buffer A, the ET-1-induced duration of calcium wave decreased compared with ET-1 alone (165.19 ± 10.11 vs 69.11 ± 12.46s, P < 0.01); 3 Preincubation with RSM in buffer B, the calcium peak value and duration of calcium wave had no significant changes (P > 0.05); 4 Preincubation with RSM, KCl-induced elevation of [Ca 2+ ]i decreased, the calcium peak value (78.02 ± 6.11 to 26.25 ± 1.19, P < 0.01) and duration of calcium wave (70.83 ± 10.36s vs 15.91 ± 5.14s, P < 0.01) both decreased significantly. Conclusions RSM increased the expression of iNOS in activated HSCs. RSM inhibited ET-1-induced depletion of intracellular calcium, had no relations with influx of extracellular. RSM can also inhibit KCl-induced calcium influx.Which showed that RSM had the character of blocking VOCC. Objective To study the change of serum levels of endotoxin, IL-4 and IL-18 in patients of various courses of chronic hepatitis B, research for their roles in the pathogenesis of chronic hepatitis B.
back_matter.section: Effects of radix salviae miltiorrhizae (RSM) on Ca 2+ and expression of NOS in hepatic stellate cells (HSCS) DONGMEI YAO Department of Gastroenterology, Second Hospital of Hebei Medical College, China

back_matter.text: The serum level of endotoxin (LPS) was determined by limulus amebocyte lysate test, the serum levels of IL-4 and IL-18 were tested by double antibody sandwith ELISA, and meanwhile routine serum biochemical tests (serum alanine transaminase (ALT), aspartate transaminase (AST), r-glutamine transpeptidase (r-GT), alkaline phosphatase (AKP), albumin, globulin, bilirubin, ets) and hematological tests (including complete cell count) were performed with routine automated techniques in 35 cases of chronic hepatitis B (CHB) and 30 cases of healthy volunteers whom were set up as the control group respectively. Results The serum levels of LPS, IL-4, IL-18 and ALT were significantly higher in the active course of CHB group (46.97 ± 13.00, 58.71 ± 9.37, 149.22 ± 66.93, 222.61 ± 220.12) than those in the inactive course of CHB group (23.73 ± 5.88, 33.83 ± 6.46, 53.54 ± 20.85, 72.10 ± 40.18) respectively (t = 2.646, p < 0.01). And there were obvious differences between chronic hepatitis B group and control group respectively (t = 2.652, p < 0.01). As the serum ALT decreased and the disease released the serum levels of four markers decreased in the inactive course in CHB group. The results of correlativity analysis indicated that in the CHB group, there were positively correlativity between the serum level of LPS and those of IL-4 and IL-18 in the active of CHB respectively (r = 0.718, 0.883, p < 0.01). So did the same between IL-14 and IL-18 (r = 0.854, p < 0.01). Conclusions The change of the levels of endotoxin, IL-4, IL-18 and interaction and interregulation on each other plays an important role in the pathogenesis and development of chronic hepatitis B.

Efficacy of thymosin alpha-1 and interferon alpha in the treatment of chronic viral hepatitis B: a randomizer controlled study JING YOU, LIN ZHUANG, YANWEI QIAO, GAO Objective To observe the efficiency and safety of Thymosin-a1 treatment in patients with hepatitis B e Antigen (HBeAg) and HBV DNA positive chronic hepatitis.

Sixty-two patients were randomly divided into group A and B, and both groups were comparable (p > 0.05) at baseline (age, sex, alanine transaminase (ALT) levels, etc.). The patients in group A received Thymosin-a1 1.6 mg subcutaneous injection two times a week (T-a1 group), and the patients in group B received Interferon alpha 3-5 MU each day for fifteen days, then three times weekly (IFN-a group) for six months. Compared results between two groups treated patients, and compared with the results observed in a group of thirty patients never treated with IFN-a and followed for 12 months (historical control (HC) group), and three groups were comparable between each other (p > 0.05).

HepG2 cells were cultured in RPMI1640 media and treated by NS-398 for 24 to 48 hours. MTT cell proliferation assay was used to observe the inhibition of HepG2 after treating by NS-398. The apoptosis of HepG2 cells was displayed by fluorescent microscopy, transmission electron microscopy and flow cytometric analysis. The expression of Bcl-2 and cycling D1 in HepG2 cells during the cell cycle and apoptosis was measured by immunocellularchemical staining. Results NS-398 could significantly inhibit HepG2 cells proliferation in a dose-and time-dependent manner. NS-398 can inhibit the growth and proliferation of HepG2 cells (P < 0.01). The treatment of NS-398 can obviously induce some morphologic features of HepG2 cell apoptosis. Cellular nucleus shrinking, nucleus fragments, luniform chromatin agglutinating and chromatin fragmentation were visualized under transmission electron microscopy. The reduction of nucleus sizes and dense nucleus were viewed under fluorescent microscopy except for NS-398 treatment group. Flow cytometric analysis showed a typical sub-G1 peak in NS-398 group and the sub-G1 peak higher in NS-398 group than in that of controls along with the increased number of apoptotic cells whereas no sub-G1 peak was shown in the NS-398 group. Compared with control, the groups of NS-398 exhibited remarkable decreases in Bcl-2 expression, while the cyclin D1 expression was downregulated in both NS-398 group. Flow cytometric analysis found a notable arrest of G1-stage-cells in NS-398 group. Conclusions COX-2 selective inhibitor NS-398 could significantly inhibite the proliferation of hepatic cancer cells, and the apoptosis and G1-cell arrest induced by NS-398 was deeply implicated in these processes. Both Bcl-2 and cycling D1 play an important role in modulating apoptosis and cell cycle arrest induced by NS-398. Conclusively, NS-398 can be a candidate agent used for HCC prevention and treatment.
Dose-effect of thioacetamide on animal model of hepatic encephalopathy in rats MEIHUA ZHANG 1 , JIA LIN 1 , DU HONG 2 , CHANGQING SHU 3 , LI ZHE 3
Objectives To investigate the correlation between dose and effect of thioacetamide (TAA) on animal model of hepatic encephalopathy in rats.
back_matter.section: Department of 1 Gastroenterology, 2 Pathology and 3 Neurology, First Municipal Hospital of Guangzhou, Guangzhou, China

back_matter.text: Animal model of hepatic encephalopathy were induced by three different dose of TAA which receiving two intraperitoneal injections of TAA 200 mg/kg, 250 mg/kg, 350 mg/kg of body weight respectively at 48 h time intervals (n = 12). Brainstem auditory evoked potentials (BAEP) and plasma endotoxin from portal vein of rats, serum ammonia, serum liver function and pathology of liver were examined. Results There are significant differences among three different dose of TAA groups in rats on incidences of HE/MHE, grades of HE, plasma endotoxin, serum ammonia, serum liver function and changes of liver pathology (P < 0.05). Conclusion There are significantly differences on animal model of hepatic encephalopathy induced by different dose of TAA in rats, which has showed significant correlation between dose and effect.Two intraperitoneal injections of TAA (200 mg/kg body weight) at 48 hour intervals is ideal method of MHE model.

Objective To investigate effects of pioglitazone on rat hepatic fibrosis and to reveal its mechanism. Methods Rat hepatic fibrosis was induced by carbon tetrachlode (CCl 4 ). Forty Sprague-Dawley rats were divided randomly into four groups: control, model, and two treatment (PI, PII) groups. Excepting rats in control group, all rats were given subcutaneous injection of 40% CCl 4 , twice a week for 8 weeks. Rats in PI, PII groups were also treated with pioglitazone of 3 mg/kg, daily via gastrogavage at the beginning of or the end of second week of administration of CCl 4 respectively. At the end ofthe experiment, all rats were sacrificed, and blood and liver tissue specimens were obtained. Liver function (ALT, AST), serum fibrotic markers (HA, LN, PCIII) and hepatic hydroxypro1ine (HP) concentration were determined respectively. Histochemical staining of formalin-dixed 1iver sections with HE Masson-Trichrome, and immunohistochemical staining for a-smooth muscle actin (a-SMA) were performed. Modifled Knodell and Chevallier semi-quantitative scoring system (SSS) was used to evaluate necroinflammatory activity and fbrosis degree. Results Compared with model group, pioglitazone significantly reduced the serum level of ALT, AST and HA, LN, PCIII (P < 0.05 or <0.01. The HP concentrations in PII (210.90 ± 24.07 mg/g), PII (257.36 ± 30.55 mg/g) groups were also lower hean those in model group (317.80 ± 36.44 mg/g) (P < 0.01). Histologic examination show thet PI, PII groups had milder hepatocellular degeneration, nicrosis and infiltration of inflammatory cells, and thinner or less fibrotic septa than did model group. The scores for nicroinflammation in PI (2.80 ± 1.03), PII (3.00 ± 1.05) groups were significantly reduced as compared with model group (4.88 ± 2.30) (P < 0.05 or <0.01; the fibrosis scores in PI (3.40 ± 1.65), PII (4.60 ± 1.35) groups were also markedly lower than those in model group (7.00 ± 3.21) (P < 0.05 or <0.01). Immunohistochemical staining showed that expression of a-SMA in PI, PII groups was smeliorated dramatically compared with model group. Conclusion PPARg agonist pioglitazone greatly retards the progression of rat hepatic fibrosis induced by CCI 4 through inhibiting activation of hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) and attenuating necroinflsmmation. Objectives To study the activity of Newcastle disease virus (strain F48E9 and La Sota) kill the human hepatocellular carcinoma cells (HCC), and analyse the manner of cell death induced by NDV.
back_matter.section: Effects of PPARg agonist pioglitazone on rat hepatic fibrosis MINGLIANG ZHANG, GUANGJIN YUAN, YUEQING YAN The Affiliated Second Hospital of Nanhua University, Hunan Hengyang, China

back_matter.text: The velogenic strain of NDV F48E9 and lentogenic strain La Sota was provided by Haerbin Veterinary Gradulate School, and in our study NDV was diluted into 10, 20 and 40. The human HCC line HEPG2 was brought from Tumor Hospital of Heilongjiang Province. The cells, which are in logarithmic propagation, were used. First, MTT was adopted to determine the activity of NDV kill HCC. Then, added the diluted virus into the cells whichObjectives Malnutrition was one of the commonest manifestations in cirrhotic patients. Introvenous supplement of branched-chain amino acids (BCAA) in cirrhotic patients was effective to correct the imbalanced Fisher ratio and improve the hypoalbuminemia. Therefore, we performed a randomized study to evaluate the effect and safety of oral branched-chain amino acids in cirrhotic patients with hypoalbuminemia. Materials and Methods One hundred and fifty cirrhotic patients with hypoalbuminia were randomly assigned to receive oral branchedchain amino acids (4.74 g of granules, BCAA group, n = 100) or with compound amino acid capsules (3.5 g of capsules, CAA goup, n = 50) for 9 weeks. Liver function test and renal function test as well as karnofsky performance was evaluated before and after the treatment. Results After the treatment, the symptoms such as fatigue and edema of the lower extremities were improved more often in BCAA group than that in CAA group (p < 0.01). Improvement rates of appetite was not statistically different (p > 0.05). Quality of life evaluated with Karnofsky performance status was also improved in both groups (p > 0.05). Serum albumin level inceeased from 32.3 ± 3.1 g/L to 37.6 ± 5.1 g/L in BCAA group and 32.1 ± 2.0 to 36.6 ± 4.7 g/L in CAA group (p < 0.05). There was no statistical difference in the increase of total serum protein between the two groups (p > 0.05). There was no obvious adverse effect in either group. Conclusions Oral branched-chain amino acids were effective and safe to increase the serum albumin level and improve symptoms and the quality of life in cirrhotic patients.
Dynamical influence of cordyceps sinensis on the activity of hepatic insulinase of experimental liver cirrhosis XIA ZHANG, YUKAN LIU, WEI SHEN, DINGMING SHEN

Objective To investigate the dynamical effects and mechanisms of Cordyceps sinensis (CS) on the activity of the hepatic insulinase in CCl4 induced liver cirrhosis in rats. Methods Rats were randomly allocated into a normal group, a model group and a CS group. Rats in normal group were sacrificed at the beginning of experiment. While other two groups were sacrificed randomly at the end of the third, the sixth and the ninth week. Blood and tissue specimen were taken. Biochemical assay were used to determine the level change of ALT, ALB content in serum. And radioimmunological assay were used to determine the level change of HA, INS content in serum and the activity of the hepatic insulinase. Results (1) The serum level of ALT, HA in the CS group was lower than that in the model group at the ninth week (P < 0.05), but the serum level of ALB in the CS group was higher than that in the model group at the ninth week (P < 0.05). (2) The serum level of insulin in the CS group and model group at the sixth and the ninth week were higher than that in the normal group (P < 0.05). But the according activity of the hepatic insulinase were lower than that in the normal group (P < 0.05, or P < 0.01). (3) There were no significant differences of the serum level of the insulin and the activity of the hepatic insulinase between the CS group and the model group at the third, the sixth and the ninth week (P > 0.05). Conclusion (1) Cordyceps sinensis may decrease the destroy of the hepatocyte by CCl4, and inhibit the hepatic fibrogenesis; (2) Cordyceps sinensis can't inhibit the decreasing of the activity of the hepatic insulinase.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Second Hospital of Chongqing University of Medical Sciences, Chongqing, China

back_matter.text: The Objectives To investigate the inhibitory effects of Arg-Gly-Asp-Ser (RGDS) tetrapeptide on focal adhesion kinase and extracellular signal-regulated kinase in rat hepatic stellate cells stimulated by fibronectin (FN). Materials and Methods 3 H-thymidine incorporation was employed to estimate the influence of RGDS on proliferation of hepatic stellate cells (HSCs). And the adhesion rates were observed by toluidine blue colorimetric assay. The expression of focal adhesion kinase (FAK) and extracellular signal-regulated kinase (ERK) both protein and mRNA in HSCs were detected by RT-PCR and Western blotting analysis respectively. Results Compared with control and FN groups, RGDS tetrapeptide at concentrations of 25 mg/ml, 50 mg/ml and 100 mg/ml inhibited the proliferation of HSCs, P < 0.01 and the inhibition rates of 100 mg/ml at 12 h, 24 h and 48 h were 62.73%, 74.23%, 80.22%, respectively. So RGDS tetrapeptide could inhibit the HSC proliferation in dose-dependent and time-dependent manners (P < 0.05, P < 0.01). After adding RGDS tetrapeptide to HSCs for 2 h, the inhibition rates of adhesion were 8.82%, 29.41% and 45.59%, respectively, but that of Arg-Gly-Glu-Ser (RGES) group was only 4.41%, F value is 20.58, P < 0.01. After exposure of HSCs to RGDS tetrapeptide for 24 h, the production of FAK protein decreased. Corresponding with the protein, FAK mRNA decreased by 62.32%, 67.68%, 76.37% about 2 h after exposure to RGDS tetrapeptide. ERK protein and ERK 1 mRNA were down-regulated by RGDS tetrapeptide by 49.70%, 86.31% and 86.30%. Conclusions These results suggest that RGDS tetrapeptide may inhibit proliferation of HSCs in both dose-dependent and timedependent manners in vitro, which may be related to the disruption of cell matrix adhesion and the down-regulation of FAK and ERK expression.
Clinical study on the severe hepatitis with nosocomial fungal infections and risk factors ZHANG XUEHAI, ZHANG GUANGHAI ET AL

Objective To study the nosocomial fungal infections in the patient with severe hepatitis and approach of risk factor. Methods All 115 severe hepatitis with fungal infections inpatients was diagnosed were studied prospectively. Results We identified 115 cases with fungal infections, the mean age of patients was 37.21 ± 21.5 years; men: 49 cases. Infection of abdominal cavity accounted for 40.9%, infection rate in respiratory tract, intestinal tract were 26.9%, 21.7%, respectively. Infection of Candida albicans accounted for 67.6%. Risk factors for fungal infection and predictors of mortality were investigated. Use of broad-spectrum antibiotic and corticosteroids, neutropenia, disease severity, improper medical manipulations as significant risk factors for fungal infection. The available antifungal chemotherapy is often unable to eradicate the infection in these patients (effective rate only 14.8%). Motality rate of study group and control group was 85.2%, 43.5%, respectively, X 2 = 43.66, p < 0.001. In multivariate analysis, being neutropenic, disseminated disease and severity were independent prognostic factors. Conclusion Identification of risk factors and predictors of a poor outcome in patients with severe hepatitis with fungal infections have important implications in prophylaxis of fungal infection, early diagnosis and appropriate therapy of these patients.
back_matter.section: Jining Infectious Diseases Hospital, Shangdong 272031, China

back_matter.text: Effects observation of plasma exchange in treatment of chronic severe hepatitis YONG ZHANG, WEIZHENG ZHENG, MINGDE JIANG, XIAOBIN CHEN, ZHAO WANG, HUI XU

Objectives To investigate the therapeutic effect of artificial liver support system (plasma exchange) in chronic severe hepatitis. Materials and Methods 32 patients with chronic severe hepatitis (mean age 40.4 ± 10.2 years, range 28 ~62 years) were treated with 59 case-times of plasma exchange. The symptoms and the result of liver function, renal function, electrolyte, prothrombintime activity (PTa), blood ammonia (NH3), blood routine before and after the treatment were analyzed. Results After plasma exchange, symptoms of patients with chronic severe hepatitis were improved, such as fatigue, appetite, and abdominal distention. Alanine tranasaminase (ALT, 179.6 ± 98.1 IU/L VS 109.7 ± 56.3 IU/L, P < 0.01) and aspartase tranasaminase (AST, 179.6 ± 98.1 VS 109.7 ± 56.3 IU/L, P < 0.01), total bilirubin (TB, 412.5 ± 154.2 mmol/L VS 226.6 ± 121.2 mmol/L, P < 0.01), direct bilirubin (DB, 202.4 ± 109.5 VS 121.3 ± 78.8, P < 0.01), NH3 (113.8 ± 72.9 mol/LVS 83.2 ± 37.7 mol/L, P < 0.05) obviously reduced, PTa obviously increased (29.4 ± 9.7% VS 38.3 ± 10.5%, P < 0.05) compared with those before the therapy. There was no significant difference in renal function, electrolyte, blood routine compared with those before the therapy (P > 0.05). The side effects were mild. The survival rate in eayly, medium-term, late chronic severe hepatitis were respectively 100% (7/7), 66.7% (10/15), 30% (3/10). Conclusions Plasma exchange is comparatively effective in the treatment of eayly, medium-term chronic severe hepatitis.Aims Using duplicated models of hepatic fibrosis in Wistar rats, we explore the mechanisms of drogs on protecting liver and treating liver fibrosis. Methods The model of hepatic fibrosis was established in 66 Wistar rats that were randomly divided into seven groups: that were the treatment groups and the normal control. The hepatic levels of MDA, HYP and the serum ALT were measured according to the biochemical methods.The pathological and ultramicropthology changes of the liver were observed by light microscope and electronmicroscope. The distribution of collagens such as type, III, IV, V as well as cytokines including IGF-TGFb1 were investigated by the immunohistochemical echnique, and the quantitative analysis by the imaging analysis system.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, General Hospital of Chengdu Command Area of Chinese PLA, Chengdu 610083, China

back_matter.text: The elevated MDA, HYP in the tissues and ALT in the serum were observed in the CCL4-induced rats rather than in the normal and the loger the experimental time of CCL4-induced rats lasted, the more the levels of these test results increased (P < 0.1). The hepatic ultramicro-pathological changes appeared as the damaged changes of the hepatic cells and infiltration of inflammatory cells in various degrees.These changes gradually increased along with the lapse of time in CCL4-induced liver fibrosis. The fibrotic proliferation was seen under the light microscope, and that the amounts of type, IV V collagens significantly increased by immunohitochemical technique in the meantime of the hepatic cells being damaged. The ALT, MDA and YHP were significantly decreased in the treatment groups compared with the untreated groups (P < 0.01) TGFb1 expression began to increase at W3 and reached to its most at w6, which began to reduce at W9. The expression of IGF-II, which was not seen at early stage of hepatic fibrosis and in control group, increased at the late stage especially when accompanied by atypical proliferation. Conclusions (1) The collagens accumulation in the liver is associated with lipoperoxidation in the course of liver fibrosis induced by CCL4 and low dose alcohol. The accumulation of type, IV, V collagens plays a important role in the liver fibrosis; (2) It is truth that improvement of hepatic lesions and decreased serum ALT and tissue MDA in the models in the drugs-treated groups which suggests that drugs might have the effects of antyhepatic damage; (3) Durgs could reduce liver HYP and decrease the accumulation of type and collagens in the liver of the models suggests that it could have the effects of anti-hepatic fibrosi; (4) TGFb1 can promote the syntheisis of extracellular interstitial substance and inhibit the degradation of collagen, it may be a major cytokine in the development of the hepatic fibrosis; (5) IGF-II can promote cell proliferation and differentiation, it may participate in the proliferation and fibrosis of hepatic cells.
Objectives To measure ghrelin, leptin levels in patients with hepatic cirrhosis and explore its relationships with nutritional status and complications.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University, Shijiazhuang, China

back_matter.text: The study comprised 45 patients with liver cirrhosis (32 males/13 females) and 18 control subjects (11 males/7 females). Fasting blood samples were obtained. Plasma ghrelin concentration was determined by enzyme immunoassay (EIA) and serum leptin, insulin, glucose levels were determined by radioimmunoassay (RIA). BMI (body mass index), body fat rate, ISI (insulin sensitivity index) were calculated. Child-pugh classification was also carried through. Results Ghrelin levels were significantly elevated in liver cirrhosis patients compared with healthy controls (3.4 ± 3.3 ng/ml vs 2.1 ± 1.4 ng/ml, P < 0.05). Correlation analysis showed that ghrelin negatively correlated with ISI (r = -0.326, P < 0.05) and body fat rate (r = -0.327, P < 0.05).There was no significant correlation between ghrelin and leptin (P > 0.05). Multiple linear regression analysis pinpointed body fat rate as the most important predictor discriminating ghrelin levels in patients with liver cirrhosis. Leptin was significantly elevated in hepatic cirrhosis patients compared with healthy controls (6.3 ± 8.0 ng/ml vs 1.2 ± 1.6 ng/ml, P < 0.001). Leptin levels became higher according to Child-pugh classification, and in Child-pugh B or C, leptin was significantly elevated compared with controls (P < 0.05). Fasting insulin levels in patients was strikingly increased compared with controls (19.6 ± 19.5 uIU/ml vs 11.1 ± 11.6 uIU/ml, P < 0.05); Glucose in patients was much higher than that in controls (7.0 ± 1.4 mmol/L vs 4.3 ± 1.0 mmol, P < 0.01). ISI in patients was significantly decreased compared with controls (-7.3 ± 1.0 vs -6.2 ± 1.2, P < 0.01). Conclusions Levels of ghrelin and leptin were elevated in patients with liver cirrhosis, they may have relations with nutritional status and complications.
Nuclear factor-kb in proliferation and apoptosis in rat hepatic stellate cells YILIN ZHENG, HUIQING JIANG, XIAOLAN ZHANG
