Objectives To explore the dynamic expression of nuclear factor-kB (NF-kB) in hepatic fibrogenesis;To investigate the effects of pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate (PDTC) on apoptosis and NF-kB binding activity in TNFa-stimulated hepatic stellate cells (HSCs) in vitro.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, The Second Hospital of Hebei Medical University, Shijiazhuang, China

back_matter.text: Expression of NF-kB protein was examined using Western blotting analysis. The distributions of NF-kB in the livers were assessed immunohistochemistrically. The direct cell count was employed to estimate proliferation of HSCs and the apoptosis was determined by Annexin-V/Propidium Iodide doublelabelled flow cytometry (FCM), while the morphological change was observed by Hoechst 33258 fluorescent stain method. NF-kB binding activity was examined by electrophoretic mobility shift assay (EMSA). Results 1 NF-kB protein expressed in normal rat livers, which were up-regulated with model course. 2 Positive cells of NF-kB increased a lot in hepatic fibrogenesis. 3 TNFa at concentration of 0.5 ng·mL -1 had the mightiest effect on HSCs proliferation. 4 Block or article-liked fluorescent light appeared in nuclei or cytoplasm of some cells treated by PDTC at different concentrations for 24 h. 5 After exposure of HSCs to PDTC for 24 h, the apoptosis rates from group 5 mmol·L -1 to group 40 mmol·L -1 were 3.61%, 8.69%, 10.14% and 16.11%, respectively, P < 0.05, while the rates of TNFa groups and control groups were 2.79% and 3.27%. 6 NF-kB binding activity was comparatively high in control groups and increased in TNFa groups, while decreased in PDTC groups. Conclusions In hepatic fibrogenesis, the expressions of NF-kB protein increased a lot, which played an important role in hepatic fibrogenesis; TNFa could stimulate the proliferation of HSCs, increase binding activity of NF-kB; PDTC might inhibit the proliferation of TNFa-stimulated HSCs and induce HSC apoptosis in dose-dependent manners; PDTC could inhibit binding activity of NF-kB.
Effects of JNK signal transduction on proliferation stimulated by acetaldehyde in hepatic stellate cells in rats XIANFEI ZHONG, MINGDE JIANG, HONGDE MA, ET AL.

Objective To explore the mechanism of how JNK Signal transduction way regulates the proliferation of hepatic satellite cells stimulated by acetaldehyde. Methods Rat hepatic satellite cells stimulated by acetaldehyde were incubated with different concentration of SP600125 in vitro, the cell proliferation was evaluated by MTT colorimetric assay; variability of JNK was examined by Western blot. Results SP600125 at different concentration (20 ng ml-1; 60 ng ml-1; 100 ng ml-1) can not only suppress the activity of JNK (MVI 36.0 ± 3.4 24.2 ± 1.8 3.2 ± 0.9 VS 47.6 ± 8.6 P < 0.05), but also inhibit proliferation of HSC (OD value A: 0.130 ± 0.011, 0.125 ± 0.009, 0.115 ± 0.013 VS 0.161 ± 0.018 P < 0.05), stimulated by acetaldehyde, in does-dependent manner. Conclusions The proliferation inhibition is correlated with the decreased activeity of JNK on the aspect of HSC signal transduction, so JNK had an important effect on proliferation of HSC.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, General Hospital of Chengduu Military Command, Chengdu 610083, China

back_matter.text: Ligating lower choledochus to establish obstructive jaundice model. All rats were randomly divided into three groups: the sham-operative group (group A, n = 20), choledochus ligation group (group B, n = 20), and choledochus ligation treated with Chinese medicine group (group C, n = 20). The changes of the level of plasma endotoxin, TNF-a, IL-6, total bilirubin 21d postoperation, were examineal and compared, the extreme intestinal lumen mucosa was examined pathologically and Bacterial culture of mesenteric lymphnodes. Panereas and lung were measured with aseptic manipulation. Results At the 21th day postoperation, the plasma total bilirubin, glutamicpyruvic transaminase (GPT) between C group and B group were no difference, with 95.5 ± 11.9 umol/L vs. 92.3 ± 12.6 umol/L (p > 0.05) and 117 ± 21 u/L vs. 118 ± 20 u/L (p > 0.05). The levels of plasma endotoxin,TNF-a, IL-6 in group C were significantly lower than those in group B, with 409 ± 38 EU/L vs. 767 ± 64 EU/L (P < 0.05), 113 ± 18 pg/ml vs. 307 ± 25 pg/ml (p < 0.05), 65 ± 8 pg/ml vs. 130 ± 12 pg/ml (p < 0.05) respectively. The trauma of intestinal mucosa in group C was lower than that in group B; The positive rate of bacteria cuture with mesenteric lympha node and pancreas, lung in group C was significantly lower than those in group B, with 5/18 vs. 16/16 (p < 0.05), 3/18 vs. 15/16 (p < 0.05), 2/18 vs. 13/16 (p < 0.05), respectively. Conclusions The Chinese medicine DaHuang et al is able to protect the barrier of intestinal mucosa, reduce the bacteria translocation from intestinal lumen and the level of plasma cytokines.

The development and application of a quality of life instrument for patients with minimal hepatic encephalopathy YINGQUN ZHOU, SHIYAO CHEN, TIANSHU LIU, JIYAO WANG Department of Gastroenterology, Shanghai Zhongshan Hospital, Shanghai, China Aim Our study is to develop a health-related quality of life (HRQOL) instrument for measuring the sense of well-being in individuals with minimal hepatic encephalopathy (mHE) and to apply the instrument for evaluating the change of QOL on the patients being treated by 4 weeks Lactulose or HepaMerz. Materials and Methods All patients were diagnosed as mHE coming from 6 hospitals which located in Beijing, Shanghai and Shandong province respectively from April 2003 to March 2004. Based on the structured group the theory and methodology were employed to establish the instrument. The drug (Lactulose or HepaMerz.) was used to treat the patients with mHE. Results The instrument included five domains (30 items) is showed as follows: physical functioning (8 items), psychological wellbeing (7 items), symptoms/side effects (7 items), social functioning (4 items) and general-health (4 items). Forty-two patients diagnosed mHE attended the clinical trial being treated by Lactulose or HepaMerz. The mean scores of the four neuropsychological indexes (NCT-A, NCT-B, DST, LTT) were lower than that after treatment in patients. Especially the mean scores of NCT-A and DST were significantly lower than the before treatment. Both the five domains and the total QOL were more improved than before treatment. In the physical domain the three most bothersome items that were drowsy, reactivity and tired showed more improved after treatment. In the symptom/side effects domain which the three symptoms were fatigue, itch and energy proved better improvement after treatment. Patients with more advanced disease (worse Child-Pugh class) seemed to have more impairment of their well-being. Conclusions We have developed the first disease specific HRQOL instrument for patients with mHE using a comprehensive methodological framework. Lactulose or HepaMerz is showed to contribute to improvements in psychomotor performance and in the quality of life of cirrhotic patients with mHE. Objectives To investigate the effectiveness and reliability of endoscopic treatment of benign esophageal lesions by using retrievable expanding stents.

There were 46 cases of benign esophageal lesions were treated with retrievable expanding stents since 1997 to 2004. Traumatic and spontaneous esophageal rupture were 8 cases, chemical burn were 9 cases. Fistula of esophageo-gastric anastomosis was 7 cases. Stenosis of esophageal-gastric anastomosis was 22 cases. The diameter of esophageal rupture and fistula of were 0.3 cm ~3 cm. Final diagnosis of all patients were X-ray and endoscope. Esophageal stenosis was expanded at least one time.When dysphagia recurs in a short time, retrievable expanding stent were placed. After 4 to 12 weeks, stent was taken out by endoscope.

Of the 46 cases, 45 (97.8%) were successfully taken out of the stent. All esophageal rupture was cured. 7 cases of esophageogastric anastomosis fistula were cured, 2 cases were ineffective. 22 cases of stenosis of esophageal-gastric anastomosis were cured. 8 of 9 cases of chemical burn were effective, and one case is failure. Complications were chest pain, pharyngeal malaise, nausea, vomiting and the symptoms of GERD. Many symptoms disappeared in one week. Anodyne was needed in 7 patients. Conclusions There are controversies in the stent therapy of benign esophageal lesions. Our results show that retrievable expanding stents therapy of esophageal benign lesions is safe and effective.

Objective To study the characteristic pathogenisis of the upper gastrointestinal disorders in the Tibet autonomous region. Methods Analyzing 44158cases under fibergastroscopic examination. Results Among all the subjects, there were 30197 cases related to inflammatory disease, 8366 cases of peptic ulcer, 1908 cases of carcinoma of upper gastrointestinal, 237 cases of upper gastrointestinal benign tumor, 474 cases of gastroduodenal polyp, 1035 cases of esophageal varicosity, and 1941 cases of others .There were 29038 male cases and 15120 female cases. The detectable rate differences between men and women was significant (p < 0.01). There were 30088 Tibetans, and 12480 Hans. The detectable rate differences between Tibetans and Hans was also significant (p < 0.01). There were 1590 cases of other minorities. Conclusion The result of this study was inflammation > ulcer > carcinoma. The incidence of male was higher than that of female. The incidence of Tibetans was higher than that of Hans. The detectable rate of inflammatory disease, ulcer and carcinorma are high in Tibet autonomous region. Among Tibetan patients with peptic ulcer, the incidence of gastric ulcer was higher than that of duodenal ulcer. These factscorrelated to the geographical environment, their daily life style, family economic status and home hygiene.
back_matter.section: Analysis of fibergastroscopic examination results of 44158 cases in the Tibet autonomous region the digestion association of Tibet autonomous region DANZHEN

back_matter.text: Applincation of endoscopic injection therapy on dieulafoy's disease bleeding HUIZHEN FAN, PING XIE, YUWENG WU, ET AL.
Objectives To determine the hemostatic effect of local endoscopic injection control of bleeding in 23 cases Dieulafoy disease.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology,Yichun Hospital Jiangxi, China

back_matter.text: To put injection needle through the biopsy channel opening of endoscopic to the bleeding parts, then inject on 3-5 points 1-2 mm surrounding the bleeding parts. Each injection contains 0.5-1 ml 5% SM or 1% AS in 23 cases. Results The hemostasis successful rate reaches 95.65% (22/23). Successful hemostasis after the second treatment occurred in 3 Cases (0.13%). 1 Cases failed to hemostasis after treatment. Conclusions These results suggest that local endoscopic injection is a first selection on control of bleeding in Dieulafoy disease. It can be wide-spread and used widely.
Gastroscopic diagnosis for gastric lymphoma XIAOJUN, GUAN JIWEI LIU, XIA XU, PEIYUN SUN, SHAOHUA ZHANG, JUN MA

Purpose To summarize the gastroscopic manifestations of 15 cases of primary gastric lymphoma. Materials and Methods Samples' source: the gastric biopsy samples and some operative pathological samples were taken from 15 hospitalized patients with gastric lymphoma diagnosed by pathology. Clinical data: there were 15 cases (9 males and 6 females), and their age ranged from 29-65 years old (median 48 years old). All cases were mainly presented with abdominal pain, weight loss and anemia. Results 15 cases of gastric lymphoma were diagnosed by pathology with gastroscopic biopsy samples. According to Ann Aobor classification, they were divided into Phase I (7 cases), Phase II (4 cases), Phase III (3 cases), and Phase IV (1 case). For gastroscopic manifestations, there were 4 types: protruded, ulcerative, phlegmonous and macrofold. Phlegmonous was the commonest among them. Because this disease extended mainly along lymphoid tissues, the lesion could expand over the pylorus into the duodenum. Discussion Gastric lymphoma occupied 3-5% of gastric malignant tumors, and 2-4% of systemic non-Hodgin's lymphomas. It was also main invasive location of extranodal non-Hodgkin's lymphomas. Because most lesions lay submucosa, diagnosis rate for routine biopsy was only 60%. Therefore, large samples should be taken for biopsy or the samples should be taken from the edge of medial ulcer. This can raise the positive diagnosis rate.
back_matter.section: Harbin Institute of Hematology and Oncology, China

back_matter.text: Objective To analyze and discuss the value of gastroscopy in diagnosis of upper gastrointestinal disease in children.
back_matter.section: An analysis of 171 cases of gastrocopy for children KEJUN GUO, CHANGHE WEI Central Hospital of Huabei Oilfield Bureau, Renqiu, Hebei, China

back_matter.text: Retrospective analysis of the data about 171 cases of gastroscopy in children was performed from 1986 to 2002. Results Out of the 171 cases of gastroscopy, 151 cases of upper gastrointestinal disease into twelve types were found. Among them, 89 cases (52.4%) were chronic superficial gastritis, 31 cases (18.2%) were duodenal ulcer, 9 cases (5.26%) were gastric ulcer, 1 cases was complex ulcer; 6 cases were duodenitis; 9 cases were esophagi. Besides, diseases such as the esophageal hiatus hemia, Mallory-Weiss syndrome, stomach cancer, stomach stone and stomach ascayiasis, each had one case. No abnormalities were found in 20 cases. Detection of helicobacter pylori (HP) infection was performed with rapid urease test in 48 children; the positive rate of HP infection was 47.9 (23/48). The locations of duodenal ulcers were mainly on anterior wall of bulb and greater curvature. The diameters of the ulcers were less than 0.5 cm mostly. Conclusions The high incidencr of chronic superficial gastritis and duodenal ulcer in always seen in children. Gastroscopy is safe and reliable method to identify the upper gastro intestinal disease in children rapidly and accurately.

Objective To evaluate the diagnostic value of endoscopic ultrasonography (EUS) on Borrmann type 4 gastric carcinoma. Methods 36 patients with Borrmann type 4 gastric carcinomas underwent EUS, endoscopy and biopsy before operation. The results were compared with those of the surgical pathological diagnosis. Results 38.9% gastric cancer with Borrmann type 4 couldn't be diagnosed by the first endoscopic biopsy, and 33.3% of those couldn't be identified by the second one yet. EUS image of Borrmann type 4 gastric cancer was special with diffuse thickness of gastric wall, but the structure and layers could still be identified.When lymph node involved, the round low echo mass with clear margin could be found. All the cases with Borrmann type 4 were correctly diagnosed preoperation by EUS. The correct rate of diagnosis by EUS for this kind of tumor was 100%.Conclusion EUS is a better and effective way for the diagnosis of the Borrmann types 4 gastric cancers.
back_matter.section: Diagnostic value of endoscopy biopsy and ultrasonic endoscope on borrmann type 4 gastric carcinoma WEN GUO, CUNLONG CHENG, TIANMING CHEN, LAN BAI, SIDE LIU, DESHOU PAN, TIANMO WAN, DAN ZHOU Digestive Diseases Institute of PLA, Nanfang Hospital, the First Military Medical University, Guangzhou 510515, China

back_matter.text: Objective To summarize the experience of diagnosing and removing foreign bodies in upper gastrointestinal tract. Materials and Methods 216 cases were examined endoscopically for their ingest foreign bodies from 1999 to 2004. Endoscopy and the instruments for grasping the foreign bodies were used. Results 216 patients had 272 pieces of foreign bodies, of which 97 pieces were impacted in the esophagus, 162 in the stomach and 11 in the duodenum. 267 pieces of bodies were successfully removed from 211 patients without any complications. But 5 pieces of bodies were failed to be taken out because the foreign bodies impacted in the gastrointestinal tract. The successful rate was 98.2% in respect to the number of patients. Among all the foreign bodies taken out, the longest one was 17.2 cm, the widest one was 3.7 cm. Conclusion Endoscopy can used safely and effectively in the patients with ingested foreign bodies.
back_matter.section: Endoscopic management of foreign bodies in the upper gastrointestinal tract: analysis of 216 cases HONGFENG HAN, YINZHONG FAN, YANWEI LI Department of Gastroenterology, Luoyang Central Hospital, Luoyang, China

back_matter.text: Objective To compare the advantages and disadvantages of singleman method (which is performed by just one operator) with those of double-men method (which is performed by one operator and one assistant) of colonoscopy, and to appeal to our fellow endoscopic physicians for single-man method on the basis of being proficient double-men method of colonoscopy.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Guangdong Provincial Corps Hospital, Chinese People's Armed Police Forces, Guangzhou, China

back_matter.text: With grouping the candidates in two groups at random, group A (examined with single-man method) and group B (examined with double-men method), two different methods of colonoscopy were employed. We compared the two methods with each other by the final location of colonoscopy in colon, the rate and the time of colonoscopy being sent to the cecum, and also observed the status of the patient's feelings and colon convulsions. Results 1. The scores of the final location of colonoscopy in colon were 4.8 ± 1.1 and 5.0 ± 1.2 (P > 0.05), the mean rates of colonoscopy being sent to the cecum were 77.3% and 86.3% (P > 0.05), in group A and group B respectively.The mean time of colonoscopy being sent to the cecum in group A was 17.8 ± 8.9 minutes, while it was 11.7 ± 5.1 minutes in the other group (P < 0.001). 2. The mean scores of the feelings of patients were 0.95 ± 0.97 and 1.02 ± 1.01 (P > 0.05), and those of the colon convulsions were 0.50 ± 0.71 and 0.43 ± 0.70 (P > 0.05) in group A and group B respectively. Conclusions It is almost the same in such indexes as the final location of colonoscopy in colon, the mean rate of colonoscopy being sent to the cecum and the score of the patient's feelings. It can be assumed that the combination of two methods will benefit us more in colonoscopy.

The relationship between expression of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and tumor infultration and metastasis in human gastric cancer, as well as patient outcome, were investigated. Methods Sixty-one primary tumor specimens were investigated by immunohistochemical studies with anti-VEGF antibody and by by monitoring patients for at least 3 years after surgery. Results The more poorly differentiated tumor was, the weaker staining intensity was. Tumor with strong VEGF staining, assessed as HP (the product of staining intensity and positive staining ration of tumor cell) ≥0.5, had a significantly more ratio of larger size tumor (diameter ≥ 4 cm) and serous membrane involvement. The Cox proportional hazards model identified tumor histology, serous membrane involvement and metastasis as the significant and independent prognostic factor among various clinicopathologic factors. Conclusion The expression of VEGF may play a role in tumor infiltration and metastasis in gastric cancer.

The clinical observation of microgalvanopuncture analgesia gastroscopy XIAOJING JIN, WANLI LIU, QIN YANG Digestion Department, Nanjing Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital, Nanjing, China Aims To observe the clinical effect of microgalvanopuncture agalgesia to gastroscopy.

The subjects was devided 2 groups randomly, single-blindness comparison, 120 cases of the acupuncture group received microgalvanopuncture on Neikuan, whose stimulating intensity was to deqi; 60 cases of the control group received microgalvanopuncture on Neikuan, but no stimulating intensity. Before and after the gastroscopy, the psychological activity, the malaise was evaluated by questionnaire and measuring meter, and the blood pressure, heart rate, breath frequency was monitored and recorded. Results Most of the subjects express fear, anxity, or dysphoria before the gastroscopy. After the examination, the malaise integral of the acupuncture group is significantly lower than the control group (P < 0.01). Conclusions The microgalvanopuncture on Neikuan can obviously reduce malaise, which is initiated by gastroscopy.Objective To investigate the safety of Propofol and Midazolam with endoscopic procedures in a cohort of elderly patients. Methods During 12 months 108 cases of endoscopy patients >65 years were eligible for propofol and midazolam study. The accumulation dosage of propofol and midazolam, sedative effect, variation of blood pressure and SaO 2 and behave in endoscopic procedures were observed in all elderly patients. Results Compared with elderly control group, there were no significant representations (nausea, cough, throat discomfort and so on) in elderly sedation group, and there were higher satisfaction with endoscopic procedures in elderly sedation group. The cumulative dosage of propofol and midazolam in elderly sedation group (>65 year) was lower than that in the elderly control group (<35 year). Arterial hypotension and a short oxygen desaturation occurred transitorily in elderly sedation group, and these changes reconvert momently after the end of endoscopic procedures. Compared with elderly control group, there were no significant uninfluenced behaves, the gastroesophageal reflux, stomach peristalsis, and pylori opening in elderly sedation group.
This present study suggests that combination propofol and midazolam with gastrointestinal endoscopic procedures in elderly patients are safe and well tolerated within careful monitoring.

The comparison research of the treatment by gianturco-rosch silicon covered esophageal expandable metallic Z-stent (GRZS) and esophageal expanding tube for advanced esophageal carcinoma JIAN LI, HONGJUN YE, FUE LI

Objective Use two kinds of methods to treat advanced esophageal carcinoma patients, and compare the improvement of survival quality and curative effect of esophagostenosis. Methods One: use GRZS which is retained by endascope to treat advanced esophageal carcinoma patients 22 cases, six of them have complicated esophago-pneogaster fistula two: retain the guide lineconductor by endoscope and guide silicagel tube MD-46100, use this kind of methods to treat advanced esophageal carcinoma patients 26 cases. Results After GRZS treatment, 22 patients esophageal empraxis degree abates from grade 3.5 ± 0.5 down to grade 0.85 ± 0.35 four weeks later, the body weight adds on 7.5 ± 0.5 kg, survival time achives to 10.3 ± 2.1 months, six of them have complicated esophagopneogaster fistula once only cure. After MD expanding treatment 26 patients esophageal empraxis degree abates from grade 3.15 ± 0.38 down to grade 2.15 ± 0.69 four weeks later, the body weight adds on 2.2 ± 0.7 kg, survival time achives to 3.7 ± 1.6 months. The GRZS treatment has obvious advantage over the MD expanding treatment in improving survival quality abating esophagostenosis degree and protracting survival time. Conclusions Retaining the Gianturo-Rosch silicon covered esophageal expandable metallic Z-stents (GRZS) by endoscope to treat advanced esophageal carcinoma that is a kind of popular palliative widely used in the world today, especially for complicated esophago-pneogaster fistulas.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Beijing University Shenzhen Hospital, Shenzhen 518036, China

back_matter.text: Endoscopic removal of a duodenal Brunner's gland adenoma-a case report WEI LI, BILI HE, HONGDI WANG

Objectives Brunner's gland adenoma (BGA) is a rare benign tumour of the duodenum. Since first reported by Curveilhier in 1835 and Salvioli in 1876, less than 200 cases of BGA have been reported. BGA is asymptomatic in most patients and incidentally finded during endoscopy or other duodenal imaging procedures. However, bleeding and/or obstructive complications may occur, endoscopic or surgical resection is needed in a minority of cases.
back_matter.section: Departments of Gastroenterology, Taizhou Hospital Zhejiang Province, Taizhou, China

back_matter.text: A 42-year-old woman presented with a month history of melena. Physical examination was unremarkable except for pale conjunctiva and skin pallor. Hemoglobin was 55 g/L. Upper endoscopy showed a large polyp which had a stalk was found situated within the duodenal bulb and several small ulcers on its surface. The stalk was then easily snared and transected using coagulation current with no bleeding. Results The polyp was 2 ¥ 2 ¥ 3 cm big, the stalk was 2 cm long. Histologically, the surface epithelium consisted of normal duodenal mucosa with areas of focal ulceration. The main body of the polyp contained several lobules of mature Brunner's glands with areas of cystic dilation.Conclusions Endoscopic electrosurgical snare resection is widely used for removal of pedunculated polyps. BGA can be successfully treated by endoscopic polypectomy without complications.

The application value of bedside emergency nasobiliary drainage in sever bile duct and pancreatic disease the first people's hospital of Nantong YUMING LI, JUNBO QIAN, YAMING WANG Department of Gastroenterology, Nantong First Hospital, China Objective To explore the therapy value and study the indication, operation skill, announcements and cost of endoscopic nasobiliary drainage (ENBD) in dangerous bile duct and pancreatic disease without x-ray monitor. Methods All 112 cases with severe bile duct and pancreatic disease accepted emergency ENBD on bedside or in duodenoscope room without x-ray monitor. The nasobiliary tube still remained in the common bile duct, then taking stone by EST, ERBD or surgery was performed on cases according to cholangiopancreatography on alternative period. Result Of all 112 cases was successfully performing ENBD in one time after final diagnosis (acute suppurative cholangitis, n = 32; Calculus of common duct, n = 24; malignant common bile duct obstruction, n = 16; acute chole-pancteatitis, n = 16; acute severe pancreatitis, n = 12). ENBD on bedside was accepted by the old and the weak whose vital sign is no good. It made an opportunity of the subsequent therapy with easy and smooth draining, shorten the course of disease and reduced the cost after applying ENBD. Conclusion The bedside emergency ENBD without x-ray monitor is an effective and safe procedure in dangerous bile duct and pancreatic diseases. It has the advantage of minimal trauma and rare complication and could be widely applied on basic hospital.

Capsule endoscopy in the evaluation of obscure gastrointestinal bleeding YUNHONG LI, ZHAOMIN XU, LONGDIAN CHEN, SHUTANG HAN, CHENGGONG YU, ZHIHONG ZHANG Department of Gastroenterology, Medical College of Nanjing University Affiliated Gulou Hospital, Nanjing, China, 210008 Objectives To evaluate the role of Capsule endoscopy (CE) in the diagnosis of Obscure gastrointestinal bleeding (OGB).

cite_spans.text: Gastroenterology, Medical College of Nanjing University Affiliated Gulou Hospital, Nanjing, China, 210008

back_matter.text: All of these patients had experienced CE after extensive traditional investigations, which could not delineate a source of OGB. Every patient received an intestinal preparation before CE examination. Results Of these 37 patients, 29 (78.4%) had abnormal findings, which could delineate the OGB. Among them, 12 patients received surgical therapy which finally verified the diagnosis as 2 intestinal angioma, 2 intestinal stromal sarcoma, 2 intestinal adenocarcinoma, 1 asending colon cancer, 1 jejunum Dieulafoy's ulcer, 1 intestinal non-Hodgkin lymphoma, 2 intestinal AVM, and 1 Meckel's diverticular. Just one diagnosis of CE was not in accord with the surgery, and in this case Meckel's diverticular was misdiagnosed as ileum ulcer. The other 17 patients who had not received surgery included 10 intestinal AVM, 3 intestinal Crohn's disease, 1 duodenum ulcer, 1 jejunum hookworm disease, 1 stoma ulcer, 1 cardiac active bleeding (second gastroscopy proved to be cardiac deulafoy's ulcer). Except 10 diffused intestinal AVM who could just be follwed up, the others had ameliorated after receiving corresponding medical therapy. Conclusions CE has high detectable rate in the diagnosis of OGB and more than 50% OGB patients may take direct advantage from CE.

Clinical study on somatostatin in prevention of hyperamylasemia and pancreatitis after ERCP ZHAOSHEN LI, GUOMING XU, ZHENXING SUN, XIAOPING ZOU, ZHENDONG JIN Department of Gastroenterology, Changhai Hospital, Second Military Medical University, Shanghai, 200433, China Objectives To study the preventive effect of somatostatin in the hyperamylasemia and pancreatitis after endoscopic retrograte cholangiopancreatography (ERCP). Methods 128 patients randomly chosen received either somatostatin (intravenously, 250 mg, at pre-ERCP and during 4 hours post-ERCP) or isotonic saline as placebo. The mean concentration of serum amylase at 4 hours and 24 hours after ERCP was measured in all patients, and the abdomenal pain and panereatitis after ERCP was also observed in all patients.

cite_spans.text: Gastroenterology, Changhai Hospital, Second Military Medical University, Shanghai, 200433, China

back_matter.text: The mean concentration of serum amylase at 4 hours and 24 hours was 298 ± 33 U/L and 140 ± 156 U/L in preventive group, 380 ± 33 U/L and 240 ± 210 U/L in control group, 3 cases have occurred acute pancreatitis in control group, and only 1 case in preventive group after ERCP. The mean concentration of serum amylase and case number of happen pancreatitis after ERCP were significantly lower in preventive group than that of in control group (P < 0.01). Conclusion It is concluded that somatostatin used pre and post-ERCP can prevent effectively hyperamylasemia and acute pancreatitis after ERCP.

Observations on curative effects of joint application of esophagus varix logation and sclerosis under endoscope DUNJU LIU, DEXIANG WANG Department of Digestion, Nanchang Municipal No.3 Hospital, Nanchang, China Objectives To observe the curative effects of joint application of esophagus varix ligation and sclerosis under endoscope. Materials and Methods Forty-one patients suffering from esophagus varix breaking haemorrhage have been operated on for Esophagus Varix Multiring Ligation (EVML) by means of high-speed repeating under endoscope. Ten cases of them were applied the joint therapy of EVML and esophagus varix sclerosis (EVS) to. Each case is ligatured three times on an average,and each time about five spots on an average. In the sclerosis therapy each case is injected 1.75 times on an average, and each time about four dots on an average. Result The cases of tangible results account for 80.5%, the effective cases-12.2%, and the total effective rate is 92.7%. Short-term or immediate curative effects of applying single EVML are tangible or remarkable, and long-time or forward curative effects of applying it are not too contented, the rate of reproducing haemorrhage within one year accounts for 27.6%, while joint applying EVML and EVS, the rate of reproducing haemorrhage in a year is zero. Conclusion The joint application of EVML and EVS is considered as the first selective therapy of curing esophagus varix breaking haemorrhage, which can effectively prevent it from reproducing haemorrhage, reduce the probability of the relapse of varicosity, and raise long-term or forward curative effects.
Study on emergency endoscopic variceal ligation (EEVL) in treatment of cirrhosis esophageal varices bleeding YUJIE LIU, ZHIJIAN ZHANG, YOUMING, HUANG ET AL.

Objective To investigate the efficacy and safety of emergency endoscopic variceal ligation (EEVL) in the treatment of cirrhosis esophageal varices bleeding. Methods 89 patients with cirrhosis esophageal varices bleeding accepted EEVL and heart rate, blood pressure, respiratory rate were observed before, during and after EEVL, respectively. Results Emergency hemostasis rates were 100%. EEVL had no significant effect on vital signs (P > 0.05). There were no adverse events duing EEVL. During a follow-up of 3 to 30 months in 76 patients with cirrhosis, the mortality was 14.5% and the rebleeding rate in the near future was 2.3%. Conclusion It is concluded that EEVL is safe, effective, reliable and short in the treatment of esophageal varices bleeding.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Donghua Hospital, Dongguan 523013, China

back_matter.text: Objective To compare the Hp infective rate in verrulous gastritis and enythema-exudative gastritis, and to explore the association between pathological character and intestinal metaplasia in verrulous gastritis.Method 141 Verrulous gastritis (VG group) and 138 enythemaexudative (EEG group) were diagnosed by endoscopy. Hp was tested by rapid urease test. Intestinal metaplasia was examined by AB/? staining, blue colour means complete intestinal metaplasia, and blue mixed with red means incomplete intestinal metaplasia. Results 1. Hp infective rate was 70.21% in verrulous gastritis and 38.40% in enythema-exudative gastriris, and there was a signiticant difference between them (P < 0.005). 2. In VG group, 99 (70.21%) cases were found chronic atrophic gastritis by pathological examination, of which 73 (51.77%) were with Hp positive and 80 (56.74%). In EEG group 81 cases were found CAG by pathologic examination, of which 81 (56.69%) accompanied with acute inflammation. Hp positive rate was in CAG and accompanied with acute inflammation between two groups. (X 2 = 16.56, P < 0.005). 3.26 intestinal metaplasia were found in VG group, and out of them, 18 (12.76%) complete intestinal metaplasia and 10 (4.26%) incomplete intestinal metaplasia; 31 (22.46%) intestinal metaplasia were found in EEG group, 18 (13.04%) complete intestinal metaplasia and 13 (9.52%) incomplete intestinal metaplasia, no significant difference was found by statistical method. Conclusion 1. Hp infection is one of the main precipitating factors of verrulous gastritis. 2. There is a close relationship between acute inflammation and Hp infection in two groups. 3. No significant difference was found in intestinal metaplasia between two groups.
back_matter.section: Analysis of endoscopic and pathological characters in verrulous gastritis JIANPING NIU, XUSHENG BAI, FENG GAO, TIELI LU, DANGXUE GUO, JIANXING LIU The Digestive Department, Shaanxi Provincial People's Hospital, China

back_matter.text: Tumors in mucosa or its muscular layer, with peduncle were resected by snare polypectomy; without peduncle were removed by pieces polypectomy with local submucosal injectin saline-epinephrine 2-4 ml. Results Thirty two of neoplasms, including early cancers 5 (esophageal 1, gastric 1, colonic 3), severe gastric epithelial dysplasia 1, leiomyoma 6 and adenoma 20 were treated by endoscopic snare polypectomy, and three cases were resected 2-3 times. The diameters of neoplasms were 1-2 cm, 2.1-3 cm, 3.1-4 cm and over 4 cm is 19, 8, 3 and 2 cases respectively. Four cases have bleeding after polypectomy, bleeding was controlled by local injection of saline-epinephrine. No severe complication as perforation was found. Conclusion Endoscopic polypectomy of gastrointestinal tract tumor with local submucosal injection of saline-epinephrine solution is an effective and safe method.
The short and long-term efficacy of endoscopic variceal ligation (EVL) plus somatostatin/octreotide post-EVL for bleeding esophageal varices JIAQI RAO, QIYI WANG, WANWEI LIU, WEIMING LIANG
Objectives To evaluate the short and long-term efficacy of endoscopic variceal ligation (EVL) plus somatostatin/Octreotide post-EVL for bleeding esophageal varices.
back_matter.section: Departments of Gastroenterology, Guangdong Provincial People's Hospital, Guangzhou, China

back_matter.text: Sixty-four cirrhosis patients with portal hypertension (male 51 cases, mean age 49 years, female 13 cases, mean age 13 years) underwent EVL within 24-48 hrs after hemorrhage. All patients accomplished EVL 78 times in total including 19 cases repeated one to four times. According to the patients' financial condition and heart situation, 78 times were divied to two groups, one only EVL, another plus somatostatin/Octreotide post-EVL. The second group received Somatostatin (250 ug per hr after a bolus of 250 ug) or Octreotide (2.5 ug per hr after a bolus of 0.1 mg) after EVL lasting 48-72 hr. There were no siginificant differences between the two groups in relation to Child-Pugh classification, characteristics of bleeding episodes. Results 64 cases were followed up, the longest period was 34 months and 15 cases were died. Only one of them died of rebleeding within 24 hr without combined using somatostatin or Octreotide. Hemostatic validity reached 93% in two groups. The rate of rebleeding and the interval of rebleeding was 59.6% and about 10 months average in EVL group and 41.9% and about 12 months average in combined group respectively. There was obvious difference between two groups (P < 0.05). Conclusion There is no obvious benifit if combined with somatostatin/Octreotide or not after EVL in the near future. But somatostatin/Octreotide seem can reduce the rate of rebleeding and prolong the interval of rebleeding in the long future.

The clinical study of detection of dysplasia and early ESCC before and after using 2.5% lugol chromoendoscopy YING SHAO, MING JI, YONGDONG WU, LI YU, YONGZHENG YU, LIANGXIAO MEI, YINGLIN NIU, ZHONGLIN YU, SHUTIAN ZHANG Endoscopic Center, Beijing Friendship Hospital affiliated to the Capital University of Medical Sciences, Beijing, 100050, China Esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) is one of the most common fatal cancers of alimentary tract. The 5-year survival rate for ESCC is less than 10%, while the 5-year survival rate for early ESCC may be up to 86%~100%. Therefore, early detection, early diagnosis and early treatment are the cruxes in reducing the mortality of ESCC. Chromoendoscopy has been used in diagnosis of early carcinomas of alimentary tract for a long time. Lulol's stain, which is paid more attention to in Japan, is the most common method to detect early ESCC. However, it has not been used widely in China. Aim To investigate the difference of detection rate of dysplasia and early ESCC before and after using Lugol chromoendoscopy. Meterials and Methods Three hundred and eighty eight patients who received routine gastroscope examination and had high risk of ESCC were examined by the iodine dyeing on their esophageal mucosa with 2.5% Lugol's solution. From every >0.5 cm in diameter unstained or light-stained area, multiple biopsies were taken for pathology. Three hundred and forty six patients who were not stained by Lugol's were received as controls. Results With the lugol's staining method, the detection rate of light, moderate and high grade dysplasia/early ESCC was 7.5% (29/388), 2.6% (10/388) and 3.4% (13/388) respectively.While in the non-stained cases, the detection rate was 3.5% (12/346), 2.3% (8/346) and 0.6 (2/346) respectively. There was significant difference between two groups. Lugol chromoendoscopy showed a sensitivity of 84.6%, a specificity of 95.7%, a positive predictive value of 37.9% and a negative predictive value of 99.4% to diagnose early ESCC/ dysplasia. Conclusion Lugol chromoendoscopy may elevate the detection rate of early ESCC/dysplasia. It is a safe, convenient and available method in early detection of ESCC/dysplasia.
Study on endoscopic ligation with three therapeutic methods for variceal hemorrhage JIANPING SHI, XIADE QIU, YUEKUNG BI, GUOMEI GU
Objective The aim of this study is to investigate the safety, efficacy, complications and recurrence of varices with three therapeutic methods endoscopic variceal ligation (EVL).
back_matter.section: Departments of Gastroenterology, Nanhui County Central Hospital, Shanghai China

back_matter.text: Sixty-nine consecutively treated cirrhotic patients were allocated in three groups, 23 in EVL with pulling line group, 21 in EVL with pneumatic group and 25 in EVLwith nylon loop group. The stiegmann-Goff device pneumatic injection and nylon loop were used for variceal ligation at the same intervals. Results The rate of variceal eradication was similar for three groups. [78% (18/23), 80.9% (17/21) and 76% (19/25)] respectively, there was no significant difference (p > 0.05). The rate of recurrent bleeding were lower in three groups treat [76% (6/23) 23.8% (5/21) and 28% (7/25)] respectively, three therapeutic groups were no significant difference (p > 0.05). No serious complication occurred in Among Groups. The mean procedure time from endoscopic insertion to removal was 21, 10, 14 min. We observed no significant systemic complication or local adverse. EVL with pneumatic was the fastest procedure. Conclusions We considered that endoscopic ligation with three therapeutic methods for variceal hemorrhage is safe and effective. EVL with pneumatic is easier to perform than other two therapeutic methods and should be the first choice.
Objectives To assess the safety, feasibility, and acceptability of sedation with propofol for endoscopic procedures.

Two hundred and twenty-six patients aged from 18 to 80 who underwent enoscopies including 148 gastroscopies and 78 colonoscopies were prospectively and nonrandomly recruited from January 2001 to April 2004. Propofol was administered intravenously by means of a patient-controlled syringe pump at the inducing dose of 2.0 mg/kg and the boosting dose of 0.5 mg/kg while the patients were continuously given oxygen by a double trunk nasal catheter at the dose of 5.0 L/min. The patient's responses, and their heart rates, blood pressure and saturation of blood oxygen during the procedure were monitored. Their anterograde amnesia rate, satisfaction rate, recovery time, delayed side-effects after the procedure were measuered. Results The onset time of propofol is 20 to 30 seconds, and its duration was 8 to 10 minutes. The patient's heart rates and blood pressure were reduced by the average of 10%, and 20%~30%, respectively, but only 12 (5.3%) patients developed hypotension during the procedure. The median recovery time was 0 (0-5) minutes. Four (1.8%) patients developed delayed side effects such as dizziness. The anterograde amnesia rate was 100% and the satisfaction rate was 100%.
The use of sedation with propofol for endoscopic procedures is safe, feasible, and acceptable to almost all patients.

A case of ischemic disease of large intestine in a polyp state XIAOYU WANG 1 , LIRONG SUI 2 , YINGZHI LV 2 & LIBIN SUN 2 Departments of 1 Endoscopy and 2 Pathology, Six Hospital of Peking, Beijing, China Objectives A case of massive haemorrhage of transient ischemic disease of large Intestine was reported with special morphological changes in endoscopy.

Examinetion by instancy colon endoscopy: There was a polyp of 0.6 cm ¥ 1.0 cm apart from anus 10 cm. It was state of cruored scab after bursted and blooding. It was resected by electricity in base of polyp of recta after affusion after 6 day. Results Pathological diagnosis of the specimen: (rectum) Colonic mucosa tissne shaved chronic inflummation with edema in stromal. There was thrombosis of blood vessels in the submucosa. Conclusions Blood is supplied by both of inferior mesenteric arteries and rectum arteries in rectum. The patient's damage site is rare.
Study of magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography comparing with endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography in the diagnosis of bile duct and pancreatic duct diseases YULIN WU

Objectives To evaluate magnetic cholangiopancreatography (MRCP) in the diagnosis of bile duct and pancreatic tract diseases, comparing with endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP). Materials and Methods 57 patients (mean age 58 years) refered for elective MRCP comparing with ERCP. After performed MRCP every patient was performed ERCP within a week. Result 57 patients were performed both MRCP and ERCP successfully. The result is the same in 35 cases. There are 23 cases in difference. MRCP: Vater's ampulla tumor 9 cases, ERCP: CBS 4 cases, normal 5 cases. MRCP: CBS 5 cases, ERCP: normal 4 cases, Vater1s ampulla tumor 1 cases. MRCP: cyst of the common bile duct 3 cases, ERCP; Vater's ampulla tumor 2 cases, CBS 1 case. Conclusion MRCP has a noninvasive diagnostic modality capable of producing high quality images of the bile duct and pancreatic duct. It is still too early to predict weather MRCP will routinely substitute ERCP for diagnosis. Further clinical trails comparing MRCP with ERCP in a larger number of cases may be necessary.
back_matter.section: Departments of Gastroenterology, The Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing, Affiliated Hospital of Medical College of Nanjing University, China

back_matter.text: Diagnostic and therapeutic ERCP in the patients with hepatobiliary stones ZIGANG WU, HONGJUN YE

Objectives To compare the diagnostic value of ERCP with abdominal B-ultrasound and CT in patients with hepatobilary diseases, to evaluate curative effect of EST, and to study the effect of octreotide and Somatostatin on the rise of pancreatic amylase in the serum and urine after ERCP and EST. Materials and Methods Forty-two patients with hepatobiliary diseases were examined with ERCP, abdominal B-ultrasound and CT simultaneously. A total of seventy-five cannulations were performed on 64 patients with hepatobilary diseases. Serum and urine amylase were checked in patients of 62 cannulations who had received octreotide and/or. Somatostatin.
back_matter.section: Departments of Gastroenterology, Shenzhen Hospital, Peking University, China Shenzhen Medical College, Peking University, Shenzhen, China

back_matter.text: The diagnostic rate of abdominal B ultrasound was 26.2%, The diagnostic rate of CT was 66.7%, and The diagnostic rate of ERCP was 97.6%. EST was performed on 36 patients with hepato-biliary diseases. Stones were removed from fourteen Patients with single common bile duct stones and nineteen patients with multple common bile duct calculi. Endoscopic drainage in eight patients is achieved by performing biliary sphincterotomy and placement of nasobiliary drain to effect irrigation. Haemorrhage, Acute cholangitis, and acute pancreatitis developed respectively in two, one and two patients after ERCP and EST. Following ERCP and EST, serum and Urine amylase values were increased in 64.71% and 70.58% of patients in the control group. Serum and Urine amylase values were increased in 17.24% and 34.48% of patients in the octreotide group. Serum and Urine amylase values were increased in 18.75% and 25.00% of patients in the Somatostatin group. Conclusions The diagnostic value of ERCP is very high. EST is a relatively safe and effective procedure in treatment of common bile duct stone. The results obtained in our study seem to indicate that octreotide and Somatostatin could prevent the increase in serum and Urine amylase values, compared to control group, but no significant difference was observed in octreotide group and the Somatostatin group.
Value of miniprobe sonography in the evaluation of remission of ulcerative colitis LU XIA, QI ZHU, JIHONG TAN

Aims Miniprobe sonography (MPS) has been shown to be useful for differentiation of acute inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) and predict the remission of UC, but it still remains controversial. The present study tried to determine the clinic value of MPS in the assessment of severity and stage of ulcerative colitis (UC). Methods 25 patients with acute UC confirmed by endoscopy and histologic examination underwent a eight-week course of oral Balsalazide sodium (6.75 g/day). Clinical, MPS (Fujinon SP701, 15 MHz) and histologic data were collected at the beginning and the end of the study. As well as five imaging parameters of the MPS features (total wall thickness, mucosal appearance, submucosal thickness, number of enlarged vessels in the submucosa and number of enlarged lymph nodes around the colon) were measured between acute flare-ups and quiescent forms of UC in the same patients. Results 20 patients completed the study. After treatment, all imaging parameters had significantly improved in patients compared with pretreatment findings. Patients after treatment chieved remission assessed as 'complete' (70%) and 'symptomatic' (85%).The MPS features were also significantly improved after treatment. There was no significant difference in the thickness of the total wall around the lesion before and after the treatment (3.84 ± 0.64 mm/3.62 ± 0.61 mm, p = 0.15). But in active cases, submucosal thickness were greater than quiescent stage (2.96 ± 0.73 mm/2.12 ± 0.35 mm, p < 0.01), the mucosa-submucosa and submucosa-muscularis propria layer borders were blurred and the pathological lymph nodes were detected in some patients (20%) even if in quiescent stage, no enlarged vessel in the submucosa was found in both stage. Conclusions This study suggests that MPS could be helpful for the transmural assessment of the colorectal wall and may contribute to the diagnosis and prediction of remission in UC.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Ruijin Hospital, Shanghai, China

back_matter.text: Objective Make an analysis of the data of 1014 cases of colonopathy for the aged so as to recognize the characters of enteroscope and clinical. Method Chose 1014 cases of colonopathy for the aged above 60 and made a review and analysis. Results Findings showed 975 cases of positive diseases (96.2%), among the former, large enteritis 35.1%, polyp 31.2%, malignant tumor 12.6%, angiectasis 6.5%, melanosis 7.3%, diverticulum 7.1%, ulcer large enteritis 1.8%, ischemic large enteritis 0.9%. The finding rate of large intestine polyp is 31.2%, among which unique incidence 41.1%, multiple incidence 59%. The likely occurring organs for polyps are sigmoid, colon ascendens, colon decendens, rectum, transverse colon, ileocecal valve. The finding rate of malignant tumor on large intestine is 12.6%. The likely occurring organs successively are sigmoid, colon decendens, rectum, ileocecal valve, colon ascendens, transverse colon. The clinical symptom is mainly diarrhoea (60.7%), others successively are constipation, diarrhoea, blood stool, abdominal distension, anaemia, thin, belly phyma. Conclusion 1. The positive finding rate among the group is high with 96.2%, and colonopathy is one of commonly-used examination methods. The three large intestines diseases with high incidence successively are large intestines inflammation, polyp and cancer. It has been known that polyp and cancer have relativity with each other, so special attention shall be paid. 2. Large intestines polyp has multiple incidences when examining, it is required to find carefully. 3. The likely occurring organs for large intestines cancer successively are sigmoid, colon ascendens, colon decendens, rectum, transverse colon, ileocecal valve and it is more important to look into ileocecal valve. 4. Abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhoea, blood stool are common symptoms. It is of key importance to inquire the medical history and make diagnosis.
back_matter.section: Analysis of 1014 cases of colonopathy for the aged HUALIN XU Digestion Department,Wuhan General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command,Wuhan, China

back_matter.text: Effect of colorectal obstruction with temporary metal internal stent dilation on operation methods HUIMIN XU, CHEN NI WEI, CHENG YING SHENG, ET AL.

Objective To explore the methods and clinical value of temporary internal metal stent by endoscopy under X ray control for treating patients with colorectal obstruction. Methods 27 patients with colorectal obstruction placed temporary metal intenal stent by endoscopy under the X ray control. Results 27 patients with colorectal obstruction symptom were disappeared within 48 hours after therapy, Elective radical resection were performed after bowel preparation. Conclution Colorectal obstruction symptom disappeared by plased metal internl stent, the therapy had higher success rate by endoscopy under X control, patients with malignant colorectal obstruction can performed Elective radical resection.
back_matter.section: Center of Endoscopy, Shanghai Jiaotong University Shanghai the Sixth People's Hospital, Shanghai 200233, China

back_matter.text: The diagnostic value of endoscopic ultrasonography in the lesion upper digestive tract PING XU, NONGHUA LU, XUANG ZHU, CHUNYAN PONG, HUAICHUN HE Department of Gastroenterology, The First Affiliated Hospital of Jiangxi Medical College, Nanchang, China Objective To investigate the diagnostic value of the lesion of upper digestive tract by endoscopic ultrasonography. Materials and Methods Endoscopic ultrasonography was applied to 73 patients with the lesion of upper digestive tract. Electronic ultra-sonic endoscopic diagnostic apparatus were brought from Olympus company, its type is Olympus GF-UM2000. The frequencies was 5 MHz, 7.5 MHz, 12 MHz, 20 MHz, respectively. All patients were applied at least two kind of frequencies. Prior to EUS, every patient was checked by gastroscopy and found the protrusion lesion of upper digestive tract, and part of patients underwent X-ray barium meal and computer tomography (CT), but were not diagnosed definitely. Results Of 73 patients in the lesion of upper digestive tract group, esophageal leiomyoma 10 (13.7%), esophageal venoneoplasia 1 (1.4%), esophageal cyst 1 (1.4%), esophageal carcinoma 1 (1.4%), compression from esophageal exterior organ 1 (1.4%), stomach leiomyoma 7 (9.6%), stomach leiomyosarcoma 1 (1.4%), stomach lymphoma 1 (1.4%), gastric ployp 8 (10.9%), gastric ulcer 3 (4.1%), gastric cancer 6 (8.2%), varicosis of gastric fundus 1 (1.4%), compression from gastric exterior organ 3 (4.1%), duodenal ployp 1 (1.4%), ectopic pancreas 1 (1.4%), pancreatic caner 6 (8.2%), pancreatic cyst 1 (1.4%), chronic pancreatitis 2 (2.7%), 18 (24.7%) patients didn't find evident abnormalities. the diagnostic accuracy of EUS was up to 95.1% and surpassed obviously 56.0% of CT and 43.1% of X-ray barium meal. Conclusions EUS has superior value to gastroscopy and X-ray barium meal and CT.

cite_spans.text: Gastroenterology, The First Affiliated Hospital of Jiangxi Medical College, Nanchang, China

back_matter.text: Anaiysis of 53 cases of the young's gastric cancer YUNZHEN YANG, FUPU LIU, SUZHEN LIU, LIHONG PAN Yuncheng Central Hospital, Yuncheng, Shanxi, 044000, China Objectives To study endoscopic appearances and pathologic characteristis in the young's gastric cancer. Methods A series of 53 cases the young's gastric carcinomas, proved bygastroscopy and operative specimens in past 15 years, were reviewed to have a further understanding of the young's gastric cancer.

The 53 caese were counted for 2.2% of 2446 gastric cancer cases in the same period, and of which 41 cases endoscop is biopsy appeared to be positive, 12 cases negative (9 cases Borrmann IV, 3 cases Borrmann II); 21 cases male, 32 cases female, at 1 : 1.5; average age 31.8 of the ages 19-35. Clinical manifestation: abdominal pain (35/53), abdominal distension and anorexia (20/53), haematemesis or hemafecia (14/53), heartburn (10/53), anemia (10/53), abdominal mass (5/53), weight loss (5/53), dysphagia (5/53), and low fever (1/53). The course lasted from 10-730 days, the average time being 2.8 months. All the cases were advanced gastric cancer. The location: cardia 4, gastric fundus 5, gastric body 20, gastric angle 7, gastric antrum 8, gastric body and antrum 9. Endoscopic revealed: Borrmann I type 6, II type 8, III type 18, IV type 21. The Histological change: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma 27, undifferentiated cancer 5, signet-ring carcinoma 10, mucinous adencarcinoma 10, adenosquamous carcinoma 1. The resectability rate was 47.1% (25/53). Conclusions The result showed that young people's gastric cancers are characterized as the following: (1) They occur frequently among female, the proportion between male and female being 1 : 1.5, higher than 1 : 1-1 : 1.26 reported in document. Most scholors believe that the higher occurrence has something to do with estrogen. (2) No clinical speciality is easily misdiagnosed as benign gastrosia. (3) Shorter coure of the disease, faster development and lower rate of resection.(4) The pathological character shows poor differention and high malignancy. We should pay more attention to the early diagnosis of the young's gastric cancer, and multilocation biopsy and deep-biopsy to suspected Borrmann IV sufferer.

Research on the safety of applying EPT in aged patients with common bile duct stones LIPING YE, MINHUA LIN, SAIQIN HE, HONGFANG, CAI JIYA, CHEN JINSHUN ZHANG Department of Digestive Diseases, Taizhou Hospital, Zhejiang, 317000 Objective To evaluate the safety of applying Endoscopic Papillotomy (EPT) in aged patients with common bile duct stones. Methods Analyze retrospectively the patients who had been treated for the common bile duct stones by EPT between Oct. 2000 -Nov. 2003 in our hospital, of whom 142 over (and of ) 65 years old as the elder group, and 224 patients less than 65 years old during the same time as the placebo group. Then compare the clinical data and the complications after EPT between the two groups. Results The rate of hypertension, coronary heart disease, diabetes mellitus, pulmonary heart disease and cerebral infarction in the elder group was higher than the other group (P < 0.05). The complications of the two groups were not very different (P > 0.05), if grasping indication strictly, using anesthetic reasonably and monitoring vital signs. Conclusion EPT is a safe and effective method to treat the aged patients for the common bile duct stones.
A safe and effective strategy for endoscopic removal of gastrointestinal lipomas HONGGANG YU, LIANGLIANG YU, JIE-PING YU, HESHENG LUO

Objective Gastrointestinal (GI) lipomas are benign, slowly growing submucosal tumors, which may cause gastrointestinal bleeding, anemia, intussusception, and bowel obstruction.The aim of this study is to explore the safe and effective strategy for endoscopic removal of GI lipomas. Methods During last decade, nineteen small sessile lipomas with base size smaller than 2 cm in diameter were resected by "pushing" technique in our hospital; the only one flat lipoma was drained by "window-opening" technique; two giant lipomas with small stalk (<2 m in diameter) were resected by polypectomy; seven giant lipomas with base size greater than 2 cm in diameter were removed using a "subtotal resection". EUS was performed in three cases from 2000~2002 to confirm that those lesions were lipomas superficial to the muscularis propria. Results All 29 lesions were successfully removed and histopathologically confirmed to be lipomas. No severe complications such as perforation and hemorrhage were developed after endoscopic removal. No recurrence was observed after 1-8 years follow-up endoscopic examination. Conclusion Various GI lipomas can be removed safely by electrosurgical snare resection under endoscopy following the guidance of the present theraputic strategy.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, Renmin Hospital of Wuhan University,Wuhan 430060, China

back_matter.text: Endoscopic management of gastrointestinal smooth muscule tumor HONGGANG YU, XIAODONG ZHOU, JIEPING YU, HESHENG LUO Department of Gastroenterology, Renmin Hospital of Wuhan University,Wuhan 430060, China Objectives Gastrointestinal smooth muscle tumors (SMTs, including leiomyoma and leiomyosarcoma) represent relatively common lesions that are thought to originate from muscular layer of gastrointestinal tract. In this study, we evaluated the efficacy and safety for endoscopic resection of submucosal leiomyoma. Our preliminary experiences on endoscopic diagnosis of gastrointestinal SMTs were also reviewed. Methods From January 1993 to May 2002, a total of 69 patients with gastrointestinal SMT (17-78 years old) underwent routine endoscopy. Endoscopic ultrasonography (EUS) was also performed in 9 cases of gastrointestinal SMT after February 2001. The sessile submucosal gastrointestinal SMTs with the base smaller than 2 cm in diameter were resected by "pushing" technique or "grasping and pushing" technique while the pedunculated SMTs were resected by polypectomy. All resected tumors were collected for histological examination. For those gastrointestinal SMTs originated from muscularis propria or with the base size ≥2 cm, ordinary biopsy technique was performed in tumors with ulcer while the "Digging" technique was performed in those without ulcer. Results In this study, 54 cases of leiomyoma and 15 cases of leiomyosarcoma were identified. In them, 19 cases of submucosal leiomyoma were resected by "pushing" technique and 10 cases were removed by "grasping and pushing" technique. Three cases pedunculated submucosal leiomyoma were resected by polypectomy. No complications such as perforation and severe bleeding developed during or after the procedure. No recurrence was observed after 1~2 years follow-up. Comparing to the final pathologic results after surgical removal, the diagnostic accuracy of ordinary and the "Digging" biopsy technique was 90.0% and 94.1%, respectively. Conclusion Endoscopic resection is a safe and effective treatment for leiomyomas with the base size £2 cm. The "digging" biopsy technique would be a good option for histologic diagnosis of SMTs.

Endoscopic and pathologic feature of fundic cancer and relationship with helicobacter pylori XIANEN YU, DAILIN WEI, PEININ HUANG, JIAZHONG LIAO, WEI LU Department of Gastroenterology, People's Hospital of Baise City, Baise, Guangxi 533000, China Objective To study the endoscopic and pathologic feature of fundic cancer and the relationship with Helicbacter pylori (Hp). Methods The endoscopic and pathologic feature and the relationship with Hp were studied in 26 patients with fundic cancer with retrospective analysis. Results 1. There were 57.7% eminence-ulcer type, 19.3% ulcer type, 11.5% eminence type and 11.5% severe erosive type in endoscopic features. 2. The pathologic positive rate was 92.3% in the first biopsies and there were 69.2% poorly differentiated adenocarcinona, 11.5% tubular adenocarcinoma, 7.7% papillary adenocarcinoma, 7.7% signer-ring cell caneer and 3.8% mucinous adenocarcinoma in total pathological sections. 3. The postive rate of Hp infection was 30.8% and the negative rate was 69.2%. Conclusion 1. The eminence-ulcer type in endoscopy and poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma in pathology were the main features of fundic cancer. 2. The Hp infection rate seems low in patients with fundic cancer.
The diagnosis valuation of ERCP to pancreaticobiliary diseases GUANGPING YUE The Central Hospital of Chengdu Railway Bureau, Chengdu 610081, China

Journal of Gastroenterology and Hepatology (2004) 19 (Suppl.) Objective To study the diagnosis valuation of Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) in pancreaticobiliary diseases. Materials and Methods ERCP was made for 262 cases of patients. After that, they were classified into several groups, such as gallstone, tumorous, benign stricture and some rare diseases. Then Analyzed their own characteristics according to the foundings from ERCP, comparing to the results made by ultrasonography and computed tomography. Results 22 cases of pancreaticobiliary opacification showed normal while other 231 cases did abnormal. Of the later group, there were 109 cases of gallstone, 84 cases of tumorous, 24 cases of inflammatory and 14 cases of other diseases. 253 cases were successfully made while 9 cases failed. The rate of success was 96.3%. Conclusions ERCP has an advantage over ultrasonography and computed tomography. It can provide clear biliary duct opacification for caput pancreatic cancer, carcinoma of ampulla, cholangiocarcinoma. ERCP has been the first option of diagnosis to the rare diseases.
Analysis of the relationship between gastroscopy changes and acute pancreatitis JIMEI ZHANG, GUOLIANG CAO, ZHIMIN WANG, XUELANG LIANG

Objectives To observe the relationship between acute pancreatitis and the accompaning damaging extent of stomach and duodenum and to guide clinic treatment. Materials and Methods 136 cases (76 of male, 60 of female, average 48 years old) of acute pancreatitis admitting in our department were analysed, Among them, 114 cases are light and 22 cases are severe; 64 caused by gall system disorder and 36 by alcohol. Gastroscopies were performed whithin one week after onset; Samples were taken from mucous membrane of gastric sinus in all cases without peptic ulcer history and examed by urea enzyme test and biopsy. 16 cases of them were companied by digestive tract bleeding (14 severe, 2 light). Incomplete closing of pylorus was observed in all cases, More reflux of gall and duodenum fluid was seen in 82 cases. Findings under gastroscopy: The mucosa of gastric body and sinus in light superficial gastritis appears piebald alternated with red and white (the majority is red). The mucosa in active gastritis and duodenitis looks like engorgement, edema, dot or patch bleeding and erosion in gastric base, body, sinus and duodenum. Dilapidation, hollow and adhering fog at bottom surrounding with engorgement and edema were found in the mucosa of gastric and duodenum ulcer. Positive diagnostic standard of HP infection: Both positives by rapid urea enzyme test and urea exhaling test is defined as positive of HP, Both negatives or one of two positive is belong to negative of HP. Results The occurring rate of acute pancreatitis companied by mucosa damages of upper digestive tract (including light superficial gastritis, active gastritis and duodenitis and gastric and duodenum ulcer) is 79.41% (108/136), among them the occurring rate in light pancreatitis is 73.68% (84/114), that in severe one is 100%. The mucosa damages give priority to active gastritis on gastric body and sinus, the more severe state of illness, the more damages in gastric and intestinal mucosa. There is statistic difference among them, P < 0.05. There are 38 cases in light and 8 in severe infected by HP. Conclusions 1,The occurring rate of acute pancreatitis companied by mucosa damages of upper digestive tract is high. 2, The more severe state of illness, the more damages in gastric and intestinal mucosa. 3, The mucosa damages in stomach are severer than that in duodenum. 4, The pathologic changes of mucosa give priority to acute damages. 5, These damages may be independent of HP infec-tion. 6, The abdominal pain can be released after treated by antiacid and gastric mucosa protecting drug.
back_matter.section: Departments of 1 Gastroenterology,Yan-An hospital of Kunming city,Yunnan, China

back_matter.text: Clinical feature and endoscopic findings in henoch-schonlein purpura LI ZHANG, LIPING DUAN, YAN XUE Department of Gastroenterology, The Third Hospital of Peking University, China Background Henoch-Schonlein purpura (HSP) is a small-vessel vasculitic disease. Abdominal pain and bleeding in gastrointestinal tract were often the first and predominant symptoms in these patients, so the diagnosis was difficult. Methods we reviewed the clinical dates of 81 patients diagnosed as HSP, and analyzed the endoscopic findings of 19 cases who received gastroduodenoscopy or colonoscopy. The histopathology of specimens form 15 cases was evaluated. Result 51 patients had a history of upper respiratory tract infection, taking medicine or variant protein before the onset of the disease. 71 patients experienced abdominal pain, which often occurred in periumbilical and epigastric regions; 34 patients had hematochezia, 18 had melena and 16 had bright blood stool. 43 patients had abdominal tenderness. Abdominal symptoms presented firstly in 21 patients, which can occur 1-40 days before the skin rashes appearing. 16 patients appeared rashes within 7 days.The main endoscopic finding include infusive edema and congestive of mucosa, multiple hemorrhagic spots, erythema, erosion and ulceration. The ulcers in stomach or duodenum were more superficial, but that in ileum seems deeper and larger. Erosion and ulcer were annulus along the folds. The findings in duodenum, especially second portion, and ileum were more severe than that in stomach or colon. The results of the microscopic examination of the specimens were: neutrophilic infiltration in mucosa and submucosa, small vessels necrosis, focal bleeding, erosion and ulceration. There are only various degrees of chronic inflammations in 7 cases. Hp was positive only in 2 cases, although the gastric biopsies were treated with W-S strain in 10 cases. Conclusion the characteristic chlinical feature and endoscopic findings may help in the diagnosis and treatment of Henoch-Schonlein purpura (HSP), especially in those typical skin rashes not occurring.Objective To study the epidemic characteristic of cancer on upper digestive. Method The3-step examination including OBB (occult blood bead test), gastroscope and pathology have been carried out for people aged than 30. Result The screening rate by OBB is 15.07% and the positive rate is 18.33%; the examination rate by gastroscope and pathology are 20.03% and 22.89% respectively, two hundred and thirteen people have been diagnosed as cancer, including 92 cases of esophagus cancer, 21 case of cardial cancer and 100 cases of gastric cancer. 1093 people were found in precancerous period and 158 people with cancer in early stage. The distribution of cancer show a remarkable difference in sexuality, age and district that the prevalence rate of man is greater than woman, age of 40-50 greater than other age, and people in rural or upland district greater than that of city or level ground. Conclusion The general examination for tumor of upper digestive tract is the solid basis for the study and prevention of cancer in the region.

Contact endoscopic argon coagulation in the treatment of erosive gastritis protuberans YEXING ZHANG*, XIAOFANG YU, KAI PAN, ET AL *Department of Endoscopy, Shen Zhen People's Hospital, Second Teaching Hospital of Jinan University, Shenzhen 518020, China Objective To study the effectiveness, efficiency and safety of the contact APC applied in patients with erosive gastritis protuberans. Method 63 patients, suffered with erosive gastritis protuberans, were divided to two groups, group A: Treated with non-contact APC and drugs; group B: treated with contact APC and drugs comparing the effectiveness, efficiency and safety. Results There is no significant difference between group A and Group B in the effectiveness (group A: cure rate : 96.8%, group B: cure rate : 96.9%, P > 0.05) and safety (only 3 cases patients had burbulece or/and abdominal pain started within 1-3 d after operation and disappeared within 3-7 d in each group, no any serious complications occurred in all 63 patients). But the number of the ineffective operation (group A: 284 times, group B: 96 times, P < 0.01), the duration of the operation (group A: 11 min 38 sec, Group B: 7 min 22 sec, P < 0.01) and the umber of accidental injury (group A: 137 times, group B: 58 times, P < 0.01) are significantly different between group A and group B. Conclusion treating erosive gastritis protuberans, contact endoscopic APC not only has excellent effectiveness and safety, but also more simple and convenient, less accidental injury and more efficient than non-contact endoscopic APC.

Treatment of erosive gastritis protuberans by means of endoscopic argon plasma coagulation (APC) ZHANG YEXIANG, YU XIAOFANG, PAN KAI, ET AL Department of Endoscopy, Shenzhen people's Hospital, the Second Teaching Hospital of Jinan University, Shenzhen 518020, China Objective To study the effectiveness and safety of the APC applied in patients with erosive gastritis protuberans. Methods 66 patients, suffered from erosive gastritis protuberans, were divided to two groups: group A: treated only with drugs firstly then by APC; group B: treated by APC and drugs simultaneously. Comparing the efficacy and safety. Results HP positive rate was 77.3% (51/66), intestinal metaplasia was found in 36.4% (24/66) patients with erosive gastritis protuberans. In group A: treated only with drugs, only 15.6% (5/32) patients were verified that the protruding lesions disappeared, but, treated with APC, all of the protruding lesions, the same as group B: were vanished, cure rate was 100%, significant higher than the patients only treated with drugs (P < 0.001) we had only one case with subcutaneous emphasema, disappeared without any treatment after 2 weeks. 7 cases patients had burbulece or and abdominal pain started within 1-3 d after operation and disappeared within 3-7 d. 69 times of APC were done and 352 Protruding lesions were treated by APC in 61 patients, the average operation time was 11 min.Conclusion HP infection play a role in the pathogency of erosive gastritis protuberans, intestinal metaplasia was found frequently in protruding lesion treating erosive gastritis protuberans with only drugs has no significant effect, APC has excellent effectiveness and safety in the treatment of erosive gastritis protuberans.

Endoscopic management of down common bile duct postcholecystectomy ZHENGKUN ZHANG Departments of Gastroenterology, Jiuquan Hospital of Gansu, Gansu, China Objectives To study the clinic value of endoscopic sphincterotomy (EST) in patients with stricture of down common bile duct postcholecystectomy. Materials and Methods 73 patients with stricture of down common bile duct were found in 174 patients with postcholecystectomy syndromes through endoscopic retrograde chalongiopancreatography (ERCP), who were treated through endoscopic sphincterotomy (EST). 7 patients with pancreatitis and 9 patients with acute cholangitis were treated through endoscopic nosobiliary drainage (ENBD) after EST. Results Relief rate of abdominal pain is respectively 83.33%, 73.81%, 80.95% in patients with simple stricture of down common bile duct and patients with stricture of down common bile duct and acute pancreatitis and patients with stricture of down common bile duct and stones. The rate of normal common bile duct, which was recovered, is respectively 100%, 88.89%, 100% in patients with simple stricture of down common bile duct and patients with stricture of down common bile duct and acute pancreatitis and patients with stricture of down common bile duct and stones. Serium ALT and AST and ALP and r-GT are normal in all patients after EST. Conclusions EST is effective in treatment of patients with stricture of down common bile duct and is first means.

Ercp for diagnosis and treatment of 173 cases of biliary and pancreatic disease ZHENZHONG ZHANG, YUANYUAN SUN, PING CHEN, ET AL Department of Gastroenterology, The 3rd People's Hospital of Nantong, China Objective To evaluate ERCP and endoscopic therapy in diagnosing and treating biliary and pancreatie diseases. Methods The clinical effect of applying duodenoendoscopy to diagnose and treat biliary and pancreatic disease on 173 patients was retrospectively analyzed. Results ERCP was successfully undergone in 93.6% of the total cases. Out of 69 cases common bile duct stones were removed in 66 cases with one session 20 cases were diagnosed as biliary or pancreatic cancer, of which 5 were treated with stent drainage. Post-ERCP pancreatitis was diagnosed in 2 patients, bleeding occurred in 2 patients. All complications were cured by non-operation methods. Conclusion ERCP is reliable on diagnosing biliary diseases and endoscopic therapy is available instead of operation.

Analysis of 69 cases by using endoscope to treat choledocholithasis ZHENZHONG ZHANG, YUANYUAN SUN, PING CHEN, ET AL Department of Gastroenterology, The 3rd People's Hospital of Nantong, China Objectives To find out the clinical value of therapeutic endoscopy to the treatment of common bile duct stone of 69 cases. Methods To use endoscape to finish ERCP and EST under the Xray monitor. The choledocholith were extracted with Dormia net basket.The bigger stones first carried out mechanical lithotripsy using BML, and then removed stones. Results To use endoscope to treat 69 cases of choledocholitasis diagnosed by ERCP. 68 cases were successfully treated by EST. All of the stones were extracted one time within 66 cases, 6 cases of all patients firstly underwent BEL mechanical lithotripay, and the removed chololith successfully.While the other 2 cases underwent the second expraction stones. Conclusions ERCP is one of the most important methods to diagnose choledocholithasis. Endoscope can also treat extrahepatic bile duct stones and residual stones after cholecystectomy and choledochotomy. ERCP and EST is an effective safe and micro-traumtic treatment for the Choledocholithasis.

Objectives To discuss the endoscopic application for diagnosis and therapy in patients with upper gastrointestinal (GI) bleeding caused by non-malignant diseases. Methods Reviewing endoscopic examination and treatment of 280 cases suffered from upper GI bleeding from September 2000 to February 2004. Results 1. The first pathogeny of upper GI bleeding is peptic ulcer (48.22%) in all cases, but it is variceal bleeding mostly among the cases with liver cirrhosis (47.37%). 2. Early endoscopy examination maybe point bleeding focus. 3.The key to hemostasia is correct choice of endoscopic hemostatic technique. 4. Roughage could result in bleeding after variceal band ligation (EVL). Conclusions 1. Knowing details of the cases may assist in choosing plan in therapeutic endoscopy. 2. We should perform endoscopic examination as soon as possible after bleeding in order to point and treat persistent bleeding. 3. Endoscopist must know well about surgery conditions and do something timely since hemostasis failure or rebleeding after therapy, including surgery. 4. Patients' diets must be paid attentions during band removing spontaneously to avoid bleeding caused by food.
back_matter.section: Department of Digestology, Tianjin 4 th Center Hospital, China

back_matter.text: Five patients (mean age 55.8 years, range 47-68 years) were diagnosed with fungal infection in biliary tract by smear or/and culture of bile obtained by ERCP and nasal-biliary tube. The clinical data of them were collected and analyzed retrospectively. All patients accepted local application through nasal-biliary tube and intravenous fluconazole for anti-fungal infections. Each drug was started immediately after positive result of smear/culture of bile and continued for at least 3 weeks. Patients were evaluated for fungal colonization, duration and efficacy of antifungal infection treatment, and drug-related side effects. Results Fungal colonizations of proven invasive fungal infections were candida glabrata (four patients), candida albicans (one patients). The mean duration of intravenous fluconazole was 30 days (24-40 days), local application of fluconazole through nasal-biliary tube was 19 days (8-24 days). The fluconazole were well tolerated excepted of nephrotoxicity of one patient. According to 3 months to 2 years follow up, all patients were proven cured. Conclusions Combining with typical clinical features of biliary tract infection, fungus detection of smear/culture of bile obtained in ERCP was the key-point for diagnosis of invasive fungal infection. Up to now, pharmacokinetics of anti-fungal medicine in biliary tract still is unknown.
