Local application through nasal-biliary tube and intravenous fluconazole would be an efficacy and safety treatment of fungal infection, and keeping nasal-biliary tube be unobstructed must be well emphasized.

A case report of the diagnosis and treatment of esophageal cavernous hemangioma XIAOYAN ZHAO, SIPING DA, PENGBIN ZHANG, LEI WANG Dept. Gastroenterology, Xinqiao Hospital, Third Military Medical University 400037, China Hamangioma of the esophagus is uncommon in patients with benign esophageal tumors. To our knowledge, there were less than 100 clinical case reports reported in the medical literature,We add a new case of esophageal hemangioma with treatment by access thoracic surgery, and evaluate the appropriate diagnostical access and review the treatment strategies for the disease. A 40-year-old woman with a history of repeated cholecystalgia underwent cholecystectomy 10 years ago. The patient complained to have been disturbed by lightly dysphagia and retrostemal pain for 1 year. The results of physical and laboratory examinations were unremarkable. However, endoscopic examination showed a protruding mass in the middle third of the esophagus, which located on the left esophageal wall 20 cm from incisors, and was covered with smooth mucosa with bluish coloration. Barium swallon examination found 2.0 cm filling defect on the middle third of the esophagus. EUS showed a hypoechoic submucosal mass compatible with a vascular stucture, projecting into the lumen. The routine B-ultrasonography also showed the same result by a specialist. In the case, we could not get a remarkable result by the either examination of CT and MRI. The tumor was completely resected by routine thoracic surgery.
Comparison analysis of clinical and endoscope manifestation of large intestinal tuberculosis and Crohn disease GUORONG ZHENG, DAOFEN LI, WEITIAN XU

Objective To analysis the clinical and endoscopic manifestation of large intestinal tuberculosis and Crohn disease so as to give a hand to diagnosis. Methods The cases of large intestinal tuberculosis and Crohn disease were collected from 1982 to 2003. The data were analyzed for clinical and endoscopic manifestation. Results 21 cases of large intestinal tuberculosis, 14 for men, 7 for women, 19 cases showing abdominal pain, 10 cases abdominal distension, 12 cases diarrhea 3 cases alternation of diarrhea and constipation, 4 cases lower temperature 10 cases speeding up of ESR.There are 15 cases of pathological change affecting caecum, 4 cases affecting end of ileum, 1 case affecting transverse colon. Under endoscope, there are 4 cases showing mocosa congestion, grain-like change and flaky erosion. The other 17 cases, there are 9 cases of ulcer, 1 case of hyperplasia, 7 cases of mixture. The ulcers mainly take round-like or irregular shape with different sizes and depths. 6 of them are confirmed by biopsy pathological diagnosis. There are 6 cases of Crohn disease, 5 for men, 1 for women, among whom, 6 cases show abdominal pain. 4 cases show diarrhoea. There 1 case affecting ileum end, 3 cases affecting caecum, 2 cases affecting both of them, 1 case affecting rectum. Under the endoscope, ulcers take irregular or elliptical shape, among which, 2 cases show crack shape, 2 cases show paving stone-like change. Conclusion The clinical and endoscopic manifestation of large intestines tuberculosis and Crohn disease do not have special characters, its diagnosis mainly is based on pathological examination. To distinguish them, besides referring to clinical and endoscopes, it is required to combine the trial anti-tuberculosis treatment and comprehensive analysis of biopsy results for many times and in many parts under endoscope.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology,Wuhan General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command,Wuhan, China

back_matter.text: Comparison studay between endoscopy and pathology on 55 cases CAG JING ZHOU, ZHIXIANG SHEN, LEI SHEN

Objective To explore the diagnostic value about various expressions under gastroscopic direct vision in chronic atrophic gastritis. Methods To contrastively analyse various expressions of CAG under gastroscopic direct vision and pathologic diagnosis in 55 cases, and to calculate respectively the sensitivity and specificity of CAG, intestinal metaplasia (IM), atypical hyperplasia (ATP) through various gastroscopic expressions. Results The coincidence of the diagnosis about CAG under gastroscopy as controlled with pathology was 85.45%. The gastroscopic sensitivity of pathologic CAG was about 12.77%~51.06%. The specificity of gastroscopic piebald change and thin-flat bulge about CAG were 87.50% and 75.00%. The specificity of some co-existed expressions was higher than that of single expression. Asper and granulelike change had higher diagnostic value about IM, its sensitivity and specificity was 66.67% and 71.74%. White-phas dominantly and blood vessel penetrately had higher sensitivity about ATP, it was 71.74%. Projecting erosion had higher specificity about ATP, it was 68.89%. Conclusion Piebald change, asper and granule-like change, whitephas dominantly and blood vessel penetrately under gastroscopic direct vision respectively possessed good value about pathologic CAG, IM, ATP. Only combined gastroscopic examination with pathologic diagnosis can correctly diagnose CAG, IM, ATP.
back_matter.section: Department of Gastroenterology, People's Hospital of Wuhan University, China

back_matter.text: Aims To study the representations of prolapse of gastric mucosa (GMP) on endoscopy. Methods summarizing the representations on endoscopy of 79 patients with GMP diagnosed during 2001~2004. Results (1) Patients diagnosed as GMP aged from 10 to 80 years.(2) The number of the prolapsed mucosa in 50 cases (63%) was one strip mucosa, two strips in 22 cases (27%) and three strips in 7 cases (8%) respectively. (3) The prolapsed mucosa in 70 cases (88.6%) was located at small flex side of stomach. (4) The prolapsed mucosa was not changed when six patients were rechecked during two weeks to one year. (5) Inflammation was founded on the surface of the prolapsed mucosa in 30 cases (38.0%). Chronic gastritis was founded in 45 cases (56.9%), included 18 cases with Striped erythma in gastric antrum. The color of fluid in gastric fundus was kelly in 7 cases.Esophagitis were founded in 4 cases (5.1%). (6) The rate of Hp infection in 79 patients with GMP patients was 11% (9 cases). Conclusions GMP can be diagnosed in every age, the number of prolapsed mucosa is commonly one strip and most of the prolapsed mucosa is located at small flex side in stomach.The prolapsed mucosa can be sustained. Chronic inflammation is common in stomach and on the surface of prolapsed mucosa. Hp infection in patients with GMP is lower.
Early rebleeding after endoscopic multiple rubber-band ligation for varices CHUANXIN ZOU, MING XIE, SHAOJUN DAI

Objective The efficacy of endoscopic multiple rubber-band ligations for esophageal varices (EV) were summarized and the causes of rebleeding investigated. Methods Selective endoscopic ligation was exercised in 43 patients with portal hypertensive EV at bleeding intervals. Each case received 1~4 sessions (2 on average) of ligation and 4~12 bands per session, totalling 5~20 bands (9.2 averagely) using Wilson-Cook's or Microvasive Co's multiple rubber-band ligator. Results The EV were eradicated or basically eradicated in 60.5% (26) of cases. Bleeding complicated in 6instances (14%), which occurred intraoperatively, 15~36 hours or 3-10 days following the procedure with 3 cases died of hemorrhagic shock and 1 from hepatic failure. Conclusions Multiple band ligations are however a method of choice for EV, bleeding from the procedure needs much attention. Its possible cases and preventive measures being discussed.
back_matter.section: Department of Digestion Jingzhou Central Hospital, Jingzhou, China

back_matter.text: Effects of interluekin 6 and retinoid acid on induced apoptosis of gastric cancer cells HONGJUN YE, ZIGANG WU, JIAZHI FANG, ET AL Shenzhen Hospital, Beijing University, Shenzhen 518036, China Objective To determine whether interleukin 6 (IL-6) and retinoid acid (RA) would induce apoptosis of gastric cancer cells in vivo.

Morphologic analysis, apoptosis rate and DNA fragmentation of SGC 7901 gastric cancer cells induced by IL-6 (Lake Placid, New Yerk) and RA (Sigma) were studied with transmission electron microscopy and agarose gel electrophoresis assays. Results Treatment SGC 7901 gastric cancer with different IL-6 and RA suppressed the growth of SGC 7901 gastric cancer in doseand time-dependent manner. There was marked difference in degree of the cytotoxicity. Electron microscopy analysis showed After 16 hours of exposure to IL-6, gastric cancer cells presented some morphologic features of apoptotic alteration, such as many cells nucleus shrinkage and chromosome condensation on edge of nucleus. After 24 hours of exposure to IL-6, cells presented chromatin condensation and nucear fragmentation. Then after 24 hours of exposure to RA, few gastric cancer cells presented cells nucleus shrinkage and chromosome condensation on edge of nucleus. Agarose gel electrophoresis of the soluble DNA exhibited the presesnce of oligonuosomal-sized fragmentation of apoptosis of 7901 gastric cancer cells induced by IL-6 is markerly than that by RA respictively. Conclusion It is suggested that IL-6 and RA induced apoptosis of gastric cancer cells.Then it is necessary to study the therapeutic value of IL-6 on gastric cancer further.

Management of unresectable carcinomas of the cardia and esophagus with covered mental stenting under the endoscopic approach DERONG WANG, SHUHONG ZHANG, SHUHONG YAN, XIULAN FENG Departments of Gastroenterology, Jinan Central Hospital, Shandong, China Objectives To evaluate the safety, clinical feasibility and long-term effectiveness of endoscopic mental stenting in patients with unresectable carcinomas of the cardia and esophagus. Materials and Methods 12 patients with unresectable carcinomas of the cardia and esophagus. (Mean age 63 years, range 48-85 years) were treated with covered mental stent implantation (CZES covered esophageal stent) under the endoscopic approach and were followed up until death. Evaluation of CZES mental stent on clinical symptom alleviation and complication rates and survival rates. Results Stents were inserted successfully under the endoscopic approach in all cases. A second stenting was needed in a patient. All of the patients experienced rapid improvement in dysphasia and other clinical symptoms. The median hospital stay for every treatment was 3.5 days (range 1-10 days). A complete follow-up until death was documented for all patients. The mean duration of follow-up of the patients was 127 days (range 45-289 days). During the entire followup, stent migrations in 1 cases and tumor overgrowth in 1cases were observed. One patient was died from cerebral embolism 2 days later. Conclusions Expandable covered mental stenting with endoscopic approach was a feasible and practical management in patients with unresectable carcinomas of the cardia and esophagus. This new approach thus represents a promising option for the treatment of unresectable carcinomas of the cardia and esophagus.

cite_spans.text: XIULAN FENG Departments of Gastroenterology, Jinan Central Hospital, Shandong, China

back_matter.text: Helicobacter pylori stool antigen test: clinical application for detection of helicobacter pylori infection in the children YANLING ZHANG, LIYING JIA, MIN LIU Department of Gastroenterology, Capital Institute of Pediatrics, Beijing, China Objective To evaluate the accuracy of the Helicobacter pyloristool antigen (HpSA) test for detection of Helicobacter pylori (Hp) infection before and after treatment in children.Methods stool specimens were collected from 62 consecutive patients (4-17 years) who received 13 C-Urea Breath Test and/or gastroscopy for gastrointestinal symptoms and 31 patients after radical cure of Hp who received 13 C-Urea Breath Test within 2 day. The evaluation of Helicobacter pylori status was defined as positive when 13 C-Urea Breath Test were positive and gastroscopic biopsy were positive. Results the sensitivity of HpSA test for the diagnosis of Helicobacter pylori using a cutoff value of 0.121 was 92.30% and its specificity was 91.30%. The positive predictive and negative predictive value was 93.30% and 87.50%, respectively, and accuracy 91.94%. Sensitivity was 83.33% and its specificity was 88.00%. The positive predictive and negative predictive value were 62.50% and 95.65%, respectively, and accuracy 87.10% after radical cure of Hp. Conclusion HpSA test is higher to diagnose Helicobacter pylori infection the precision ration before the radical cure in children sensitivity and specificity after the radical cure are lower than before. Objective To investigate the influence of emodin on proliferation and cell cycle of hepatic stellate cell line-T6 and explore its mechanisms of antifibrotic. Methods The rat hepatic stellate cell line, HSC-T6 was generationally cultured in DMEM medium. Emodin of various concentrations was added to the medium in 48 hours. The changes of cell morphplogy, cell cycle, and expression of PCNAwere observed. The effects of emodin on proliferation of T6 cells were observed. Results (1) Emodin markedly inhibited the proliferation of HSC-T6 after 24 hours culture with concentration of 5~15 mg/L. The expression of PCNA proteins indicated the positive rate decreased along with the increase of concentration.

(2) The test data from flow cytometer showed emodin can block the cell cycle and along with the increase of concentration, the percentage of the cells in S phase and G 2 /M phase were gradually decreased and that in G 0 /G 1 increased. Conclusion Emodin can significantly prevent HSC-T6 cell proliferation significantly in vitro. The effect may be associated with changing the normal cell cycle of T6 cells and is time and concentration dependent on.
back_matter.section: Effects of Emodin on Proliferation and cell cycle of HSC-T6 in Vitro
